content.text: I have installed claude code here on my personal macbook and on my work windows pc. I'd like to always have all the settings and all the things related to claude code always synced between the two laptops so i can work from home and don't spend time moving CLAUDE.md files back and forth. Please help me achieving this. I found this github project tha seems weel done but it has some thing related to the correct folders directories and other config files position that seem off:  https://github.com/shaike1/claude-sync  please clone the project, fix any issue you might find and then help me set it up
I'll help you set up Claude Code syncing between your macOS and Windows laptops. Let me start by cloning the project and examining it to identify and fix any issues.

Test the sync functionality
Provide setup instructions for both macOS and Windows

1â†’# ğŸ”„ Claude Context Sync 2â†’ 3â†’**Seamlessly sync your Claude Code context and data across multiple PCs using GitHub** 4â†’ 5â†’[![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow.svg)](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT) 6â†’[![GitHub stars](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/shaike1/claude-sync.svg)](https://github.com/shaike1/claude-sync/stargazers) 7â†’ 8â†’## ğŸ¯ What This Solves 9â†’ 10â†’Using Claude Code on multiple PCs? Tired of manually copying `CLAUDE.md` files between machines? This tool automatically syncs your entire Claude Code experience across all your devices. 11â†’ 12â†’## ğŸš€ Features 13â†’ 14â†’### ğŸ”§ Essential Sync 15â†’- **`CLAUDE.md`** - Your project contexts 16â†’- **Claude Settings** - Preferences and configurations 17â†’- **Conversation Sessions** - Complete chat history (up to 1MB+) 18â†’- **MCP Configurations** - Server setups and integrations 19â†’- **Todo Lists** - Task tracking data 20â†’ 21â†’### ğŸŒŸ Full Sync (Everything) 22â†’- All essential items **PLUS**: 23â†’- **Shell Integration** - Custom shell snapshots 24â†’- **Slash Commands** - Your custom Claude commands 25â†’- **Complete User Profile** - Every setting preserved 26â†’ 27â†’## ğŸ“¥ One-Line Installation 28â†’ 29â†’### Basic Context Sync 30â†’```bash 31â†’curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO 32â†’``` 33â†’ 34â†’### Full Data Sync (Recommended) 35â†’```bash 36â†’curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO full 37â†’``` 38â†’ 39â†’## ğŸ› ï¸ Quick Setup 40â†’ 41â†’### 1. Create GitHub Repository 42â†’1. Go to [GitHub](https://github.com/new) 43â†’2. Create a **private** repository named `claude-sync` 44â†’3. Don't initialize with README 45â†’ 46â†’### 2. Install on First PC 47â†’```bash 48â†’# Replace with your GitHub username 49â†’curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync full 50â†’``` 51â†’ 52â†’### 3. Install on Other PCs 53â†’Run the same command on all other machines - they'll sync automatically! 54â†’ 55â†’### 4. Start Using 56â†’- Use `/sync-push-full` to upload your data 57â†’- Use `/sync-pull-full` to download from other PCs 58â†’- Use `/sync-full` for bidirectional sync 59â†’ 60â†’## ğŸ“ Available Slash Commands 61â†’ 62â†’After installation, these commands are available in Claude Code: 63â†’ 64â†’| Command | Description | 65â†’|---------|-------------| 66â†’| `/sync-pull` | Pull basic context from GitHub | 67â†’| `/sync-push` | Push basic context to GitHub | 68â†’| `/sync-pull-full` | Pull ALL Claude data (sessions, settings, MCP) | 69â†’| `/sync-push-full` | Push ALL Claude data | 70â†’| `/sync-full` | Complete bidirectional sync | 71â†’| `/sync-status` | Show sync configuration and status | 72â†’ 73â†’## ğŸ—ï¸ Architecture 74â†’ 75â†’```mermaid 76â†’graph LR 77â†’ A[PC 1
Claude Code] --> B[GitHub Repo
Private] 78â†’ B --> C[PC 2
Claude Code] 79â†’ B --> D[PC 3
Claude Code] 80â†’ 81â†’ A -.->|/sync-push-full| B 82â†’ B -.->|/sync-pull-full| C 83â†’ B -.->|/sync-pull-full| D 84â†’``` 85â†’ 86â†’## ğŸ”„ How It Works 87â†’ 88â†’1. **Local Changes**: Edit your `CLAUDE.md` or use Claude Code normally 89â†’2. **Push Changes**: `/sync-push-full` uploads your data to GitHub 90â†’3. **Pull Updates**: `/sync-pull-full` on another PC downloads everything 91â†’4. **Smart Merging**: Conflicts are resolved automatically 92â†’5. **Session Continuity**: Continue conversations from any PC 93â†’ 94â†’## ğŸ“Š What Gets Synced 95â†’ 96â†’### Essential Level 97â†’- âœ… Project contexts (`CLAUDE.md`) 98â†’- âœ… Claude settings (`~/.claude.json`) 99â†’- âœ… All conversation sessions (`~/.claude/projects/`) 100â†’- âœ… MCP server configurations 101â†’- âœ… User preferences (`~/.claude/settings.local.json`) 102â†’- âœ… Todo lists (`~/.claude/todos/`) 103â†’ 104â†’### Full Level 105â†’- âœ… Everything from Essential 106â†’- âœ… Shell integration (`~/.claude/shell-snapshots/`) 107â†’- âœ… Custom slash commands (`~/.claude-code/slash-commands/`) 108â†’ 109â†’## ğŸ›¡ï¸ Security & Privacy 110â†’ 111â†’- **Private Repository**: All data stored in your private GitHub repo 112â†’- **No Credentials Stored**: Uses your existing Git configuration 113â†’- **Selective Sync**: Choose essential or full sync levels 114â†’- **Encrypted Transit**: All data encrypted via HTTPS 115â†’- **Machine Identification**: Each PC gets a unique, anonymous ID 116â†’ 117â†’## ğŸ”§ Manual Installation 118â†’ 119â†’If you prefer manual setup: 120â†’ 121â†’```bash 122â†’# 1. Download the sync scripts 123â†’curl -o ~/claude-sync.py https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync.py 124â†’curl -o ~/claude-sync-extended.py https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync-extended.py 125â†’chmod +x ~/claude-sync*.py 126â†’ 127â†’# 2. Configure your repository 128â†’~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo https://github.com/USERNAME/claude-sync.git --level full 129â†’ 130â†’# 3. Create slash commands (see install script for details) 131â†’mkdir -p ~/.claude-code/slash-commands 132â†’# ... download individual command files 133â†’``` 134â†’ 135â†’## ğŸ¯ Use Cases 136â†’ 137â†’### ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» Developers 138â†’- Work on projects from multiple machines 139â†’- Keep all conversation history synchronized 140â†’- Maintain consistent MCP server setups 141â†’ 142â†’### ğŸ¢ Teams 143â†’- Share Claude configurations across team members 144â†’- Maintain consistent development environments 145â†’- Collaborate on Claude-assisted projects 146â†’ 147â†’### ğŸŒ Remote Workers 148â†’- Seamless transition between home and office PCs 149â†’- Keep all AI assistance context synchronized 150â†’- Never lose conversation history 151â†’ 152â†’## ğŸ› Troubleshooting 153â†’ 154â†’### Repository Access Issues 155â†’```bash 156â†’# Ensure Git is configured 157â†’git config --global user.name "Your Name" 158â†’git config --global user.email "your.email@example.com" 159â†’ 160â†’# Test repository access 161â†’git clone https://github.com/USERNAME/claude-sync.git 162â†’``` 163â†’ 164â†’### Sync Conflicts 165â†’```bash 166â†’# Check sync status 167â†’/sync-status 168â†’ 169â†’# Force clean sync 170â†’cd ~/.claude-sync/data/repo 171â†’git reset --hard origin/main 172â†’/sync-pull-full 173â†’``` 174â†’ 175â†’### Missing Dependencies 176â†’```bash 177â†’# Ensure Python 3 is available 178â†’python3 --version 179â†’ 180â†’# Check Git installation 181â†’git --version 182â†’``` 183â†’ 184â†’## ğŸ¤ Contributing 185â†’ 186â†’Contributions welcome! Please: 187â†’ 188â†’1. Fork the repository 189â†’2. Create a feature branch 190â†’3. Submit a pull request 191â†’4. Follow existing code style 192â†’ 193â†’### Development Setup 194â†’```bash 195â†’git clone https://github.com/shaike1/claude-sync.git 196â†’cd claude-sync 197â†’chmod +x *.py *.sh 198â†’``` 199â†’ 200â†’## ğŸ“ˆ Roadmap 201â†’ 202â†’- [ ] **Cloud Storage Support** - S3, Dropbox, Google Drive backends 203â†’- [ ] **Real-time Sync** - WebSocket-based live synchronization 204â†’- [ ] **Conflict Resolution UI** - Visual merge tool for complex conflicts 205â†’- [ ] **Selective Sync** - Choose specific conversations/projects to sync 206â†’- [ ] **Backup & Restore** - Point-in-time recovery of synced data 207â†’- [ ] **Team Sharing** - Shared contexts for collaborative projects 208â†’ 209â†’## ğŸ“œ License 210â†’ 211â†’MIT License - see [LICENSE](LICENSE) for details. 212â†’ 213â†’## ğŸ™ Acknowledgments 214â†’ 215â†’- **Anthropic** - For creating Claude Code 216â†’- **Community** - For feedback and suggestions 217â†’- **Contributors** - Everyone who helped improve this tool 218â†’ 219â†’## ğŸ“ Support 220â†’ 221â†’- **Issues**: [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/shaike1/claude-sync/issues) 222â†’- **Discussions**: [GitHub Discussions](https://github.com/shaike1/claude-sync/discussions) 223â†’- **Documentation**: This README and inline code comments 224â†’ 225â†’--- 226â†’ 227â†’**Made with â¤ï¸ for the Claude Code community** 228â†’ 229â†’### â­ Star This Repository 230â†’If this tool helps you, please star the repository to help others discover it! 231â†’ 232â†’### ğŸ”— Share 233â†’Found this useful? Share it with other Claude Code users! Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.

# ğŸ”„ Claude Context Sync **Seamlessly sync your Claude Code context and data across multiple PCs using GitHub** [![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow.svg)](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT) [![GitHub stars](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/shaike1/claude-sync.svg)](https://github.com/shaike1/claude-sync/stargazers) ## ğŸ¯ What This Solves Using Claude Code on multiple PCs? Tired of manually copying `CLAUDE.md` files between machines? This tool automatically syncs your entire Claude Code experience across all your devices. ## ğŸš€ Features ### ğŸ”§ Essential Sync - **`CLAUDE.md`** - Your project contexts - **Claude Settings** - Preferences and configurations - **Conversation Sessions** - Complete chat history (up to 1MB+) - **MCP Configurations** - Server setups and integrations - **Todo Lists** - Task tracking data ### ğŸŒŸ Full Sync (Everything) - All essential items **PLUS**: - **Shell Integration** - Custom shell snapshots - **Slash Commands** - Your custom Claude commands - **Complete User Profile** - Every setting preserved ## ğŸ“¥ One-Line Installation ### Basic Context Sync ```bash curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO ``` ### Full Data Sync (Recommended) ```bash curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/YOUR_REPO full ``` ## ğŸ› ï¸ Quick Setup ### 1. Create GitHub Repository 1. Go to [GitHub](https://github.com/new) 2. Create a **private** repository named `claude-sync` 3. Don't initialize with README ### 2. Install on First PC ```bash # Replace with your GitHub username curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync full ``` ### 3. Install on Other PCs Run the same command on all other machines - they'll sync automatically! ### 4. Start Using - Use `/sync-push-full` to upload your data - Use `/sync-pull-full` to download from other PCs - Use `/sync-full` for bidirectional sync ## ğŸ“ Available Slash Commands After installation, these commands are available in Claude Code: | Command | Description | |---------|-------------| | `/sync-pull` | Pull basic context from GitHub | | `/sync-push` | Push basic context to GitHub | | `/sync-pull-full` | Pull ALL Claude data (sessions, settings, MCP) | | `/sync-push-full` | Push ALL Claude data | | `/sync-full` | Complete bidirectional sync | | `/sync-status` | Show sync configuration and status | ## ğŸ—ï¸ Architecture ```mermaid graph LR A[PC 1
Claude Code] --> B[GitHub Repo
Private] B --> C[PC 2
Claude Code] B --> D[PC 3
Claude Code] A -.->|/sync-push-full| B B -.->|/sync-pull-full| C B -.->|/sync-pull-full| D ``` ## ğŸ”„ How It Works 1. **Local Changes**: Edit your `CLAUDE.md` or use Claude Code normally 2. **Push Changes**: `/sync-push-full` uploads your data to GitHub 3. **Pull Updates**: `/sync-pull-full` on another PC downloads everything 4. **Smart Merging**: Conflicts are resolved automatically 5. **Session Continuity**: Continue conversations from any PC ## ğŸ“Š What Gets Synced ### Essential Level - âœ… Project contexts (`CLAUDE.md`) - âœ… Claude settings (`~/.claude.json`) - âœ… All conversation sessions (`~/.claude/projects/`) - âœ… MCP server configurations - âœ… User preferences (`~/.claude/settings.local.json`) - âœ… Todo lists (`~/.claude/todos/`) ### Full Level - âœ… Everything from Essential - âœ… Shell integration (`~/.claude/shell-snapshots/`) - âœ… Custom slash commands (`~/.claude-code/slash-commands/`) ## ğŸ›¡ï¸ Security & Privacy - **Private Repository**: All data stored in your private GitHub repo - **No Credentials Stored**: Uses your existing Git configuration - **Selective Sync**: Choose essential or full sync levels - **Encrypted Transit**: All data encrypted via HTTPS - **Machine Identification**: Each PC gets a unique, anonymous ID ## ğŸ”§ Manual Installation If you prefer manual setup: ```bash # 1. Download the sync scripts curl -o ~/claude-sync.py https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync.py curl -o ~/claude-sync-extended.py https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync-extended.py chmod +x ~/claude-sync*.py # 2. Configure your repository ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo https://github.com/USERNAME/claude-sync.git --level full # 3. Create slash commands (see install script for details) mkdir -p ~/.claude-code/slash-commands # ... download individual command files ``` ## ğŸ¯ Use Cases ### ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» Developers - Work on projects from multiple machines - Keep all conversation history synchronized - Maintain consistent MCP server setups ### ğŸ¢ Teams - Share Claude configurations across team members - Maintain consistent development environments - Collaborate on Claude-assisted projects ### ğŸŒ Remote Workers - Seamless transition between home and office PCs - Keep all AI assistance context synchronized - Never lose conversation history ## ğŸ› Troubleshooting ### Repository Access Issues ```bash # Ensure Git is configured git config --global user.name "Your Name" git config --global user.email "your.email@example.com" # Test repository access git clone https://github.com/USERNAME/claude-sync.git ``` ### Sync Conflicts ```bash # Check sync status /sync-status # Force clean sync cd ~/.claude-sync/data/repo git reset --hard origin/main /sync-pull-full ``` ### Missing Dependencies ```bash # Ensure Python 3 is available python3 --version # Check Git installation git --version ``` ## ğŸ¤ Contributing Contributions welcome! Please: 1. Fork the repository 2. Create a feature branch 3. Submit a pull request 4. Follow existing code style ### Development Setup ```bash git clone https://github.com/shaike1/claude-sync.git cd claude-sync chmod +x *.py *.sh ``` ## ğŸ“ˆ Roadmap - [ ] **Cloud Storage Support** - S3, Dropbox, Google Drive backends - [ ] **Real-time Sync** - WebSocket-based live synchronization - [ ] **Conflict Resolution UI** - Visual merge tool for complex conflicts - [ ] **Selective Sync** - Choose specific conversations/projects to sync - [ ] **Backup & Restore** - Point-in-time recovery of synced data - [ ] **Team Sharing** - Shared contexts for collaborative projects ## ğŸ“œ License MIT License - see [LICENSE](LICENSE) for details. ## ğŸ™ Acknowledgments - **Anthropic** - For creating Claude Code - **Community** - For feedback and suggestions - **Contributors** - Everyone who helped improve this tool ## ğŸ“ Support - **Issues**: [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/shaike1/claude-sync/issues) - **Discussions**: [GitHub Discussions](https://github.com/shaike1/claude-sync/discussions) - **Documentation**: This README and inline code comments --- **Made with â¤ï¸ for the Claude Code community** ### â­ Star This Repository If this tool helps you, please star the repository to help others discover it! ### ğŸ”— Share Found this useful? Share it with other Claude Code users!

1â†’#!/usr/bin/env python3
     2â†’"""
     3â†’Claude Context Sync - Simplified version with no external dependencies
     4â†’"""
     5â†’
     6â†’import os
     7â†’import json
     8â†’import hashlib
     9â†’import datetime
    10â†’import argparse
    11â†’import subprocess
    12â†’import time
    13â†’from pathlib import Path
    14â†’from typing import Dict
    15â†’
    16â†’class ClaudeSync:
    17â†’    def __init__(self, config_path: str = "~/.claude-sync/config.json"):
    18â†’        self.config_path = Path(config_path).expanduser()
    19â†’        self.config = self.load_config()
    20â†’        self.sync_dir = Path(self.config.get("sync_dir", "~/.claude-sync/contexts")).expanduser()
    21â†’        self.sync_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
    22â†’        
    23â†’    def load_config(self) -> Dict:
    24â†’        """Load or create configuration"""
    25â†’        if self.config_path.exists():
    26â†’            with open(self.config_path, 'r') as f:
    27â†’                return json.load(f)
    28â†’        
    29â†’        # Create default config
    30â†’        default_config = {
    31â†’            "sync_method": "git",
    32â†’            "git_repo": "",
    33â†’            "auto_sync": True,
    34â†’            "machine_id": self.generate_machine_id()
    35â†’        }
    36â†’        
    37â†’        self.config_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
    38â†’        with open(self.config_path, 'w') as f:
    39â†’            json.dump(default_config, f, indent=2)
    40â†’        
    41â†’        return default_config
    42â†’    
    43â†’    def generate_machine_id(self) -> str:
    44â†’        """Generate unique machine identifier"""
    45â†’        machine_info = f"{os.uname().nodename}-{os.getuid()}"
    46â†’        return hashlib.md5(machine_info.encode()).hexdigest()[:8]
    47â†’    
    48â†’    def run_git_command(self, args: list, cwd: Path = None) -> tuple:
    49â†’        """Run a git command and return (success, output)"""
    50â†’        try:
    51â†’            result = subprocess.run(
    52â†’                ["git"] + args,
    53â†’                cwd=cwd or self.sync_dir,
    54â†’                capture_output=True,
    55â†’                text=True,
    56â†’                check=True
    57â†’            )
    58â†’            return True, result.stdout
    59â†’        except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e:
    60â†’            return False, e.stderr
    61â†’    
    62â†’    def sync_git(self, operation: str = "both") -> bool:
    63â†’        """Sync using Git repository"""
    64â†’        repo_path = self.sync_dir / "repo"
    65â†’        
    66â†’        # Clone repository if it doesn't exist
    67â†’        if not repo_path.exists():
    68â†’            print(f"Cloning repository...")
    69â†’            success, output = self.run_git_command(
    70â†’                ["clone", self.config["git_repo"], str(repo_path)]
    71â†’            )
    72â†’            if not success:
    73â†’                print(f"Failed to clone repository: {output}")
    74â†’                return False
    75â†’        
    76â†’        # Change to repo directory
    77â†’        original_dir = os.getcwd()
    78â†’        os.chdir(repo_path)
    79â†’        
    80â†’        try:
    81â†’            if operation in ["pull", "both"]:
    82â†’                print("Pulling latest changes...")
    83â†’                success, output = self.run_git_command(["pull", "--rebase"], repo_path)
    84â†’                
    85â†’                if success:
    86â†’                    # Copy contexts to working directory
    87â†’                    for context_file in repo_path.glob("*.md"):
    88â†’                        if context_file.name not in ["README.md", "LICENSE.md"]:
    89â†’                            self.merge_context(context_file)
    90â†’                else:
    91â†’                    print(f"Pull failed: {output}")
    92â†’            
    93â†’            if operation in ["push", "both"]:
    94â†’                # Copy local context to repo
    95â†’                claude_md = Path(original_dir) / "CLAUDE.md"
    96â†’                if claude_md.exists():
    97â†’                    dest = repo_path / f"CLAUDE-{self.config['machine_id']}.md"
    98â†’                    dest.write_text(claude_md.read_text())
    99â†’                    
   100â†’                    # Stage, commit and push
   101â†’                    self.run_git_command(["add", "."], repo_path)
   102â†’                    
   103â†’                    commit_msg = f"Update from {self.config['machine_id']} at {datetime.datetime.now()}"
   104â†’                    self.run_git_command(["commit", "-m", commit_msg], repo_path)
   105â†’                    
   106â†’                    print("Pushing changes...")
   107â†’                    success, output = self.run_git_command(["push"], repo_path)
   108â†’                    if not success:
   109â†’                        print(f"Push failed: {output}")
   110â†’                        return False
   111â†’                else:
   112â†’                    print("No CLAUDE.md file found in current directory")
   113â†’        
   114â†’        finally:
   115â†’            os.chdir(original_dir)
   116â†’        
   117â†’        return True
   118â†’    
   119â†’    def merge_context(self, remote_file: Path) -> None:
   120â†’        """Merge remote context with local"""
   121â†’        local_claude = Path.cwd() / "CLAUDE.md"
   122â†’        
   123â†’        if not local_claude.exists():
   124â†’            # No local file, just copy
   125â†’            local_claude.write_text(remote_file.read_text())

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Claude Context Sync - Simplified version with no external dependencies
"""

import os
import json
import hashlib
import datetime
import argparse
import subprocess
import time
from pathlib import Path
from typing import Dict

class ClaudeSync:
    def __init__(self, config_path: str = "~/.claude-sync/config.json"):
        self.config_path = Path(config_path).expanduser()
        self.config = self.load_config()
        self.sync_dir = Path(self.config.get("sync_dir", "~/.claude-sync/contexts")).expanduser()
        self.sync_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        
    def load_config(self) -> Dict:
        """Load or create configuration"""
        if self.config_path.exists():
            with open(self.config_path, 'r') as f:
                return json.load(f)
        
        # Create default config
        default_config = {
            "sync_method": "git",
            "git_repo": "",
            "auto_sync": True,
            "machine_id": self.generate_machine_id()
        }
        
        self.config_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        with open(self.config_path, 'w') as f:
            json.dump(default_config, f, indent=2)
        
        return default_config
    
    def generate_machine_id(self) -> str:
        """Generate unique machine identifier"""
        machine_info = f"{os.uname().nodename}-{os.getuid()}"
        return hashlib.md5(machine_info.encode()).hexdigest()[:8]
    
    def run_git_command(self, args: list, cwd: Path = None) -> tuple:
        """Run a git command and return (success, output)"""
        try:
            result = subprocess.run(
                ["git"] + args,
                cwd=cwd or self.sync_dir,
                capture_output=True,
                text=True,
                check=True
            )
            return True, result.stdout
        except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e:
            return False, e.stderr
    
    def sync_git(self, operation: str = "both") -> bool:
        """Sync using Git repository"""
        repo_path = self.sync_dir / "repo"
        
        # Clone repository if it doesn't exist
        if not repo_path.exists():
            print(f"Cloning repository...")
            success, output = self.run_git_command(
                ["clone", self.config["git_repo"], str(repo_path)]
            )
            if not success:
                print(f"Failed to clone repository: {output}")
                return False
        
        # Change to repo directory
        original_dir = os.getcwd()
        os.chdir(repo_path)
        
        try:
            if operation in ["pull", "both"]:
                print("Pulling latest changes...")
                success, output = self.run_git_command(["pull", "--rebase"], repo_path)
                
                if success:
                    # Copy contexts to working directory
                    for context_file in repo_path.glob("*.md"):
                        if context_file.name not in ["README.md", "LICENSE.md"]:
                            self.merge_context(context_file)
                else:
                    print(f"Pull failed: {output}")
            
            if operation in ["push", "both"]:
                # Copy local context to repo
                claude_md = Path(original_dir) / "CLAUDE.md"
                if claude_md.exists():
                    dest = repo_path / f"CLAUDE-{self.config['machine_id']}.md"
                    dest.write_text(claude_md.read_text())
                    
                    # Stage, commit and push
                    self.run_git_command(["add", "."], repo_path)
                    
                    commit_msg = f"Update from {self.config['machine_id']} at {datetime.datetime.now()}"
                    self.run_git_command(["commit", "-m", commit_msg], repo_path)
                    
                    print("Pushing changes...")
                    success, output = self.run_git_command(["push"], repo_path)
                    if not success:
                        print(f"Push failed: {output}")
                        return False
                else:
                    print("No CLAUDE.md file found in current directory")
        
        finally:
            os.chdir(original_dir)
        
        return True
    
    def merge_context(self, remote_file: Path) -> None:
        """Merge remote context with local"""
        local_claude = Path.cwd() / "CLAUDE.md"
        
        if not local_claude.exists():
            # No local file, just copy
            local_claude.write_text(remote_file.read_text())
            print(f"Created CLAUDE.md from {remote_file.name}")
            return
        
        # Simple merge: append unique content
        local_content = local_claude.read_text()
        remote_content = remote_file.read_text()
        
        if remote_content not in local_content:
            # Backup local
            backup = local_claude.with_suffix(".md.bak")
            backup.write_text(local_content)
            
            # Merge by appending
            merged = local_content + "\n\n" + f"# Merged from {remote_file.stem}\n\n" + remote_content
            local_claude.write_text(merged)
            print(f"Merged content from {remote_file.name}")
    
    def sync(self, operation: str = "both") -> bool:
        """Main sync method"""
        if not self.config.get("git_repo"):
            print("Error: No Git repository configured. Run 'setup' first.")
            return False
        
        return self.sync_git(operation)
    
    def setup_hooks(self) -> None:
        """Setup Claude Code hooks for automatic sync"""
        hooks_dir = Path.home() / ".claude-code" / "hooks"
        hooks_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        
        script_path = Path(__file__).absolute()
        
        # Create session-start hook
        start_hook = hooks_dir / "session-start.sh"
        start_hook.write_text(f"""#!/bin/bash
# Auto-sync Claude context at session start
cd ~
{script_path} pull
""")
        start_hook.chmod(0o755)
        
        # Create session-end hook  
        end_hook = hooks_dir / "session-end.sh"
        end_hook.write_text(f"""#!/bin/bash
# Auto-sync Claude context at session end
cd ~
{script_path} push
""")
        end_hook.chmod(0o755)
        
        print(f"âœ… Hooks installed in {hooks_dir}")
        print("Context will sync automatically on session start/end")


def main():
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Claude Context Sync")
    parser.add_argument("action", choices=["setup", "sync", "pull", "push", "hooks"],
                        help="Action to perform")
    parser.add_argument("--git-repo", help="Git repository URL for sync")
    
    args = parser.parse_args()
    
    sync = ClaudeSync()
    
    if args.action == "setup":
        if args.git_repo:
            sync.config["git_repo"] = args.git_repo
            with open(sync.config_path, 'w') as f:
                json.dump(sync.config, f, indent=2)
            print(f"âœ… Configuration saved to {sync.config_path}")
            print(f"Repository: {args.git_repo}")
            print(f"Machine ID: {sync.config['machine_id']}")
        else:
            print("Error: --git-repo required for setup")
    
    elif args.action == "sync":
        if sync.sync("both"):
            print("âœ… Sync completed")
    
    elif args.action == "pull":
        if sync.sync("pull"):
            print("âœ… Pull completed")
    
    elif args.action == "push":
        if sync.sync("push"):
            print("âœ… Push completed")
    
    elif args.action == "hooks":
        sync.setup_hooks()


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

   255â†’            # Append remote content
   256â†’            with open(dest_file, 'w') as f:
   257â†’                f.write(local_content)
   258â†’                f.write(f"\n\n# Merged from {source_file.parent.name}\n\n")
   259â†’                f.write(remote_content)
   260â†’    
   261â†’    def merge_directory(self, source_dir: Path, dest_dir: Path, merge_mode: str = "update") -> None:
   262â†’        """Merge directories based on mode"""
   263â†’        dest_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
   264â†’        
   265â†’        for item in source_dir.rglob("*"):
   266â†’            if item.is_file():
   267â†’                rel_path = item.relative_to(source_dir)
   268â†’                dest_item = dest_dir / rel_path
   269â†’                
   270â†’                if merge_mode == "append" or not dest_item.exists():
   271â†’                    dest_item.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
   272â†’                    shutil.copy2(item, dest_item)
   273â†’                elif merge_mode == "update":
   274â†’                    # Update if source is newer
   275â†’                    if item.stat().st_mtime > dest_item.stat().st_mtime:
   276â†’                        shutil.copy2(item, dest_item)
   277â†’    
   278â†’    def sync_git(self, operation: str = "both") -> bool:
   279â†’        """Sync using Git repository"""
   280â†’        repo_path = self.sync_dir / "repo"
   281â†’

   288â†’                ], check=True, capture_output=True)
   289â†’            except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e:
   290â†’                print(f"âŒ Clone failed: {e}")

   292â†’

   294â†’        os.chdir(repo_path)

   300â†’                self.restore_sync_data(repo_path)

   311â†’

   314â†’                commit_msg = f"Sync from {self.config['machine_id']} at {datetime.datetime.now()}"
   315â†’                subprocess.run(["git", "commit", "-m", commit_msg], check=False)
   316â†’                subprocess.run(["git", "push"], check=True)
   317â†’                
   318â†’                print("âœ… Data synced to repository")
   319â†’        
   320â†’        except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e:
   321â†’            print(f"âŒ Sync failed: {e}")
   322â†’            return False
   323â†’        finally:
   324â†’            os.chdir(original_dir)
   325â†’        
   326â†’        return True
   327â†’    
   328â†’    def sync(self, operation: str = "both") -> bool:
   329â†’        """Main sync method"""
   330â†’        if not self.config.get("git_repo"):
   331â†’            print("âŒ No Git repository configured. Run 'setup' first.")
   332â†’            return False
   333â†’        
   334â†’        return self.sync_git(operation)

#!/bin/bash
# Claude Context Sync Extended - Full sync installer
# Usage: curl -sSL https://example.com/install-full.sh | bash -s -- REPO_URL [essential|full]

set -e

GREEN='\033[0;32m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
NC='\033[0m'

echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸš€ Claude Context Sync Extended Installer${NC}"
echo "=========================================="

# Get arguments
GITHUB_REPO="${1:-}"
SYNC_LEVEL="${2:-essential}"

if [ -z "$GITHUB_REPO" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}Enter your GitHub repository URL:${NC}"
    read -r GITHUB_REPO
fi

if [[ ! "$GITHUB_REPO" =~ ^https://github\.com/[^/]+/[^/]+(.git)?$ ]]; then
    echo -e "${RED}âŒ Invalid GitHub repository URL${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

if [[ ! "$GITHUB_REPO" =~ \.git$ ]]; then
    GITHUB_REPO="${GITHUB_REPO}.git"
fi

# Validate sync level
if [[ "$SYNC_LEVEL" != "essential" && "$SYNC_LEVEL" != "full" ]]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}âš  Invalid sync level '$SYNC_LEVEL', using 'essential'${NC}"
    SYNC_LEVEL="essential"
fi

echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ“¦ Installing Claude Context Sync Extended...${NC}"
echo "Repository: $GITHUB_REPO"
echo "Sync Level: $SYNC_LEVEL"

# Create directories
mkdir -p ~/.claude-code/slash-commands
mkdir -p ~/.claude-sync

# Download the extended sync script
echo "ğŸ“¥ Downloading claude-sync-extended.py..."
curl -sSL -o ~/claude-sync-extended.py \
    https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync-extended.py
chmod +x ~/claude-sync-extended.py

# Create enhanced slash commands
echo "ğŸ“ Creating extended slash commands..."

# /sync-full-setup
cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-full-setup.md << 'EOF'
Configure Claude Context Sync Extended with full data synchronization.

```bash
if [ -z "$1" ]; then
    echo "Usage: /sync-full-setup <github-repo-url> [essential|full]"
    echo "Sync levels:"
    echo "  essential - CLAUDE.md, settings, sessions, MCP configs"
    echo "  full      - Everything including shell snapshots, slash commands"
    exit 1
fi

LEVEL="${2:-essential}"
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo "$1" --level "$LEVEL"
echo "âœ… Extended sync configured!"
echo "ğŸ“Š Run /sync-status to see what will be synced"
```
EOF

# /sync-status
cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-status.md << 'EOF'
Show detailed Claude Context Sync status and what will be synced.

```bash
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py status
```
EOF

# /sync-pull-full
cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-pull-full.md << 'EOF'
Pull ALL Claude data from remote repository (sessions, settings, MCP configs).

```bash
cd ~
echo "ğŸ”„ Pulling full Claude data from remote..."
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py pull
echo "âœ… Full data sync completed!"
echo "ğŸ“‹ Your sessions, settings, and MCP configs are now synchronized"
```
EOF

# /sync-push-full
cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-push-full.md << 'EOF'
Push ALL Claude data to remote repository for other PCs to access.

```bash
cd ~
echo "ğŸ“¤ Pushing full Claude data to remote..."
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py push
echo "âœ… All data pushed to remote!"
echo "ğŸ”— Other PCs can now pull your sessions, settings, and configurations"
```
EOF

# /sync-full
cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-full.md << 'EOF'
Perform complete bidirectional sync of ALL Claude data.

```bash
cd ~
echo "ğŸ”„ Performing full Claude data sync..."
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py sync
echo "âœ… Complete sync finished!"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“Š Synced data includes:"
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ’¬ All conversation sessions"
echo "  â€¢ âš™ï¸  Claude settings and preferences" 
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ”Œ MCP server configurations"
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ“ Todo lists and task data"
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ—‚ï¸  Project-specific contexts"
```
EOF

# Keep the simple commands too
cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-pull.md << 'EOF'
Pull Claude context from remote (essential data only).

```bash
cd ~
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py pull
echo "âœ… Essential data synchronized"
```
EOF

cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-push.md << 'EOF'
Push Claude context to remote (essential data only).

```bash
cd ~
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py push
echo "âœ… Essential data pushed"
```
EOF

# Setup with provided repo and level
echo -e "\n${BLUE}âš™ï¸  Configuring with repository and sync level...${NC}"
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo "$GITHUB_REPO" --level "$SYNC_LEVEL"

# Show status
echo -e "\n${BLUE}ğŸ“Š Current sync configuration:${NC}"
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py status

# Try initial sync
echo -e "\n${BLUE}ğŸ”„ Attempting initial sync...${NC}"
if python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py push 2>/dev/null; then
    echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Initial sync successful${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}â„¹ï¸  Initial sync skipped (repository might be empty)${NC}"
fi

echo -e "\n${GREEN}âœ¨ Claude Context Sync Extended installed!${NC}"
echo -e "\n${BLUE}ğŸ“‹ Available commands:${NC}"
echo "Essential sync:"
echo "  /sync-pull          - Pull context and basic settings"
echo "  /sync-push          - Push context and basic settings"
echo ""
echo "Extended sync:"
echo "  /sync-pull-full     - Pull ALL Claude data (sessions, MCP, etc.)"
echo "  /sync-push-full     - Push ALL Claude data"
echo "  /sync-full          - Complete bidirectional sync"
echo "  /sync-status        - Show detailed sync status"
echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ¯ What gets synced at '$SYNC_LEVEL' level:${NC}"

if [ "$SYNC_LEVEL" = "essential" ]; then
    echo "  âœ… CLAUDE.md context files"
    echo "  âœ… Claude settings (~/.claude.json)"
    echo "  âœ… Conversation sessions"
    echo "  âœ… MCP server configurations"
    echo "  âœ… Todo lists"
else
    echo "  âœ… Everything from 'essential' plus:"
    echo "  âœ… Shell integration snapshots"
    echo "  âœ… Custom slash commands"
    echo "  âœ… All user preferences"
fi

echo -e "\n${BLUE}ğŸš€ Quick start:${NC}"
echo "1. Use /sync-push-full to upload your current Claude setup"
echo "2. On other PCs, install with same repo and run /sync-pull-full"
echo "3. All your sessions, settings, and configs will be synchronized!"
echo -e "\n${GREEN}Happy syncing! ğŸ‰${NC}"

content.text:
Based on my comprehensive research, here's the complete information about Claude Code configuration files and data directories for both macOS and Windows:

## Claude Code Directory Structure and File Locations

### 1. Configuration Files (.claude.json)

**Primary Configuration Locations:**
- **Recommended**: `~/.claude.json` (cross-platform, most reliable)
- **Alternative**: `~/.claude/settings.json` (user settings for all projects)

**Platform-specific Claude Desktop Config (different from CLI):**
- **macOS**: `~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json`
- **Windows**: `%APPDATA%\Claude\claude_desktop_config.json`
- **Linux**: `~/.config/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json`

### 2. Session Data/Project Data

**Main Storage Directory:** `~/.claude/`

**Session Storage Structure:**
```
~/.claude/
â”œâ”€â”€ projects/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ [encoded-directory-paths]/
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ [session-uuid].jsonl     # Full conversation history
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ [summary-uuid].jsonl     # Conversation summaries
â”œâ”€â”€ settings.json                    # Global user preferences
â”œâ”€â”€ .credentials.json               # Authentication data
â””â”€â”€ statsig/                        # Analytics and session tracking
```

**Project-specific Storage:**
- `.claude/` directory in each project root
- Independent conversation history per directory
- JSONL format (JSON Lines) for easy parsing

### 3. Settings Files

**User-level Settings:**
- `~/.claude/settings.json` - Global user settings
- `~/.claude.json` - Main configuration file
- `~/.claude/CLAUDE.md` - Global behavior defaults

**Project-level Settings:**
- `.claude/settings.json` - Shared project settings (version controlled)
- `.claude/settings.local.json` - Personal project settings (not version controlled)

### 4. MCP Configurations

**Configuration Storage Locations:**
- **Project-specific**: `.claude/settings.local.json` or `.mcp.json`
- **User-specific**: `~/.claude/settings.local.json`
- **Global**: `~/.claude.json`

**MCP Server Logs:**
- **macOS**: `~/Library/Application Support/Claude/mcp.log`
- **Error logs**: `mcp-server-SERVERNAME.log` files

### 5. Todo Lists

Todo lists are managed through Claude Code's built-in TodoWrite tool and stored as part of the session data in the projects directory structure mentioned above.

### 6. Shell Snapshots

Shell snapshots and environment data are handled through:
- Integration with your existing bash environment
- Access to shell tools and scripts
- Environment inheritance from your current shell session

### 7. Slash Commands Directory

**Command Storage Locations:**
- **Project-level**: `.claude/commands/` (shareable with team)
- **User-level**: `~/.claude/commands/` (personal commands across all projects)

**Command Structure:**
- Markdown files become slash commands automatically
- Subdirectories create namespaced commands (e.g., `.claude/commands/frontend/component.md` â†’ `/frontend:component`)
- Support for arguments using `$ARGUMENTS` placeholder

### 8. Additional Directories

**Subagents:**
- `~/.claude/agents/` - User subagents (available across all projects)
- `.claude/agents/` - Project-specific subagents

**Hooks:**
- `.claude/hooks/` - Custom command files and hooks

**Memory Files:**
- `./CLAUDE.md` - Project-specific memory (should be version controlled)
- `~/.claude/CLAUDE.md` - Global memory file

### 9. Enterprise/Managed Settings

**Platform-specific Enterprise Locations:**
- **macOS**: `/Library/Application Support/ClaudeCode/managed-settings.json`
- **Windows**: `C:\ProgramData\ClaudeCode\managed-settings.json`
- **Linux/WSL**: `/etc/claude-code/managed-settings.json`

## Key Notes

1. **Cross-platform Paths**: The `~` symbol represents the user's home directory on all platforms
2. **Multiple Config Locations**: Claude Code supports multiple configuration locations for legacy compatibility
3. **Project Independence**: Each project directory maintains completely independent conversation history
4. **Version Control**: Use `.claude/settings.json` for team-shared settings and `.claude/settings.local.json` for personal preferences
5. **Command Organization**: Slash commands can be organized both at user and project levels with automatic recognition

This structure provides a flexible system that supports both individual developer preferences and team collaboration while maintaining proper separation between different types of configuration data.

toolUseResult.originalFileContents:
#!/bin/bash
# Claude Context Sync Extended - Full sync installer
# Usage: curl -sSL https://example.com/install-full.sh | bash -s -- REPO_URL [essential|full]

set -e

GREEN='\033[0;32m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
NC='\033[0m'

echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸš€ Claude Context Sync Extended Installer${NC}"
echo "=========================================="

# Get arguments
GITHUB_REPO="${1:-}"
SYNC_LEVEL="${2:-essential}"

if [ -z "$GITHUB_REPO" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}Enter your GitHub repository URL:${NC}"
    read -r GITHUB_REPO
fi

if [[ ! "$GITHUB_REPO" =~ ^https://github\.com/[^/]+/[^/]+(.git)?$ ]]; then
    echo -e "${RED}âŒ Invalid GitHub repository URL${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

if [[ ! "$GITHUB_REPO" =~ \.git$ ]]; then
    GITHUB_REPO="${GITHUB_REPO}.git"
fi

# Validate sync level
if [[ "$SYNC_LEVEL" != "essential" && "$SYNC_LEVEL" != "full" ]]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}âš  Invalid sync level '$SYNC_LEVEL', using 'essential'${NC}"
    SYNC_LEVEL="essential"
fi

echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ“¦ Installing Claude Context Sync Extended...${NC}"
echo "Repository: $GITHUB_REPO"
echo "Sync Level: $SYNC_LEVEL"

# Create directories
mkdir -p ~/.claude-code/slash-commands
mkdir -p ~/.claude-sync

# Download the extended sync script
echo "ğŸ“¥ Downloading claude-sync-extended.py..."
curl -sSL -o ~/claude-sync-extended.py \
    https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync-extended.py
chmod +x ~/claude-sync-extended.py

# Create enhanced slash commands
echo "ğŸ“ Creating extended slash commands..."

# /sync-full-setup
cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-full-setup.md << 'EOF'
Configure Claude Context Sync Extended with full data synchronization.

```bash
if [ -z "$1" ]; then
    echo "Usage: /sync-full-setup <github-repo-url> [essential|full]"
    echo "Sync levels:"
    echo "  essential - CLAUDE.md, settings, sessions, MCP configs"
    echo "  full      - Everything including shell snapshots, slash commands"
    exit 1
fi

LEVEL="${2:-essential}"
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo "$1" --level "$LEVEL"
echo "âœ… Extended sync configured!"
echo "ğŸ“Š Run /sync-status to see what will be synced"
```
EOF

# /sync-status
cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-status.md << 'EOF'
Show detailed Claude Context Sync status and what will be synced.

```bash
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py status
```
EOF

# /sync-pull-full
cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-pull-full.md << 'EOF'
Pull ALL Claude data from remote repository (sessions, settings, MCP configs).

```bash
cd ~
echo "ğŸ”„ Pulling full Claude data from remote..."
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py pull
echo "âœ… Full data sync completed!"
echo "ğŸ“‹ Your sessions, settings, and MCP configs are now synchronized"
```
EOF

# /sync-push-full
cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-push-full.md << 'EOF'
Push ALL Claude data to remote repository for other PCs to access.

```bash
cd ~
echo "ğŸ“¤ Pushing full Claude data to remote..."
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py push
echo "âœ… All data pushed to remote!"
echo "ğŸ”— Other PCs can now pull your sessions, settings, and configurations"
```
EOF

# /sync-full
cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-full.md << 'EOF'
Perform complete bidirectional sync of ALL Claude data.

```bash
cd ~
echo "ğŸ”„ Performing full Claude data sync..."
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py sync
echo "âœ… Complete sync finished!"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“Š Synced data includes:"
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ’¬ All conversation sessions"
echo "  â€¢ âš™ï¸  Claude settings and preferences" 
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ”Œ MCP server configurations"
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ“ Todo lists and task data"
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ—‚ï¸  Project-specific contexts"
```
EOF

# Keep the simple commands too
cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-pull.md << 'EOF'
Pull Claude context from remote (essential data only).

```bash
cd ~
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py pull
echo "âœ… Essential data synchronized"
```
EOF

cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-push.md << 'EOF'
Push Claude context to remote (essential data only).

```bash
cd ~
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py push
echo "âœ… Essential data pushed"
```
EOF

# Setup with provided repo and level
echo -e "\n${BLUE}âš™ï¸  Configuring with repository and sync level...${NC}"
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo "$GITHUB_REPO" --level "$SYNC_LEVEL"

# Show status
echo -e "\n${BLUE}ğŸ“Š Current sync configuration:${NC}"
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py status

# Try initial sync
echo -e "\n${BLUE}ğŸ”„ Attempting initial sync...${NC}"
if python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py push 2>/dev/null; then
    echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Initial sync successful${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}â„¹ï¸  Initial sync skipped (repository might be empty)${NC}"
fi

echo -e "\n${GREEN}âœ¨ Claude Context Sync Extended installed!${NC}"
echo -e "\n${BLUE}ğŸ“‹ Available commands:${NC}"
echo "Essential sync:"
echo "  /sync-pull          - Pull context and basic settings"
echo "  /sync-push          - Push context and basic settings"
echo ""
echo "Extended sync:"
echo "  /sync-pull-full     - Pull ALL Claude data (sessions, MCP, etc.)"
echo "  /sync-push-full     - Push ALL Claude data"
echo "  /sync-full          - Complete bidirectional sync"
echo "  /sync-status        - Show detailed sync status"
echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ¯ What gets synced at '$SYNC_LEVEL' level:${NC}"

if [ "$SYNC_LEVEL" = "essential" ]; then
    echo "  âœ… CLAUDE.md context files"
    echo "  âœ… Claude settings (~/.claude.json)"
    echo "  âœ… Conversation sessions"
    echo "  âœ… MCP server configurations"
    echo "  âœ… Todo lists"
else
    echo "  âœ… Everything from 'essential' plus:"
    echo "  âœ… Shell integration snapshots"
    echo "  âœ… Custom slash commands"
    echo "  âœ… All user preferences"
fi

echo -e "\n${BLUE}ğŸš€ Quick start:${NC}"
echo "1. Use /sync-push-full to upload your current Claude setup"
echo "2. On other PCs, install with same repo and run /sync-pull-full"
echo "3. All your sessions, settings, and configs will be synchronized!"
echo -e "\n${GREEN}Happy syncing! ğŸ‰${NC}"

Push ALL Claude data to remote repository for other PCs to access.

Pull Claude context from remote (essential data only).
Push Claude context to remote (essential data only).

toolUseResult.originalFileContents:
#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Claude Context Sync - Simplified version with no external dependencies
"""

import os
import json
import hashlib
import datetime
import argparse
import subprocess
import time
from pathlib import Path
from typing import Dict

class ClaudeSync:
    def __init__(self, config_path: str = "~/.claude-sync/config.json"):
        self.config_path = Path(config_path).expanduser()
        self.config = self.load_config()
        self.sync_dir = Path(self.config.get("sync_dir", "~/.claude-sync/contexts")).expanduser()
        self.sync_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        
    def load_config(self) -> Dict:
        """Load or create configuration"""
        if self.config_path.exists():
            with open(self.config_path, 'r') as f:
                return json.load(f)
        
        # Create default config
        default_config = {
            "sync_method": "git",
            "git_repo": "",
            "auto_sync": True,
            "machine_id": self.generate_machine_id()
        }
        
        self.config_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        with open(self.config_path, 'w') as f:
            json.dump(default_config, f, indent=2)
        
        return default_config
    
    def generate_machine_id(self) -> str:
        """Generate unique machine identifier"""
        machine_info = f"{os.uname().nodename}-{os.getuid()}"
        return hashlib.md5(machine_info.encode()).hexdigest()[:8]
    
    def run_git_command(self, args: list, cwd: Path = None) -> tuple:
        """Run a git command and return (success, output)"""
        try:
            result = subprocess.run(
                ["git"] + args,
                cwd=cwd or self.sync_dir,
                capture_output=True,
                text=True,
                check=True
            )
            return True, result.stdout
        except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e:
            return False, e.stderr
    
    def sync_git(self, operation: str = "both") -> bool:
        """Sync using Git repository"""
        repo_path = self.sync_dir / "repo"
        
        # Clone repository if it doesn't exist
        if not repo_path.exists():
            print(f"Cloning repository...")
            success, output = self.run_git_command(
                ["clone", self.config["git_repo"], str(repo_path)]
            )
            if not success:
                print(f"Failed to clone repository: {output}")
                return False
        
        # Change to repo directory
        original_dir = os.getcwd()
        os.chdir(repo_path)
        
        try:
            if operation in ["pull", "both"]:
                print("Pulling latest changes...")
                success, output = self.run_git_command(["pull", "--rebase"], repo_path)
                
                if success:
                    # Copy contexts to working directory
                    for context_file in repo_path.glob("*.md"):
                        if context_file.name not in ["README.md", "LICENSE.md"]:
                            self.merge_context(context_file)
                else:
                    print(f"Pull failed: {output}")
            
            if operation in ["push", "both"]:
                # Copy local context to repo
                claude_md = Path(original_dir) / "CLAUDE.md"
                if claude_md.exists():
                    dest = repo_path / f"CLAUDE-{self.config['machine_id']}.md"
                    dest.write_text(claude_md.read_text())
                    
                    # Stage, commit and push
                    self.run_git_command(["add", "."], repo_path)
                    
                    commit_msg = f"Update from {self.config['machine_id']} at {datetime.datetime.now()}"
                    self.run_git_command(["commit", "-m", commit_msg], repo_path)
                    
                    print("Pushing changes...")
                    success, output = self.run_git_command(["push"], repo_path)
                    if not success:
                        print(f"Push failed: {output}")
                        return False
                else:
                    print("No CLAUDE.md file found in current directory")
        
        finally:
            os.chdir(original_dir)
        
        return True
    
    def merge_context(self, remote_file: Path) -> None:
        """Merge remote context with local"""
        local_claude = Path.cwd() / "CLAUDE.md"
        
        if not local_claude.exists():
            # No local file, just copy
            local_claude.write_text(remote_file.read_text())
            print(f"Created CLAUDE.md from {remote_file.name}")
            return
        
        # Simple merge: append unique content
        local_content = local_claude.read_text()
        remote_content = remote_file.read_text()
        
        if remote_content not in local_content:
            # Backup local
            backup = local_claude.with_suffix(".md.bak")
            backup.write_text(local_content)
            
            # Merge by appending
            merged = local_content + "\n\n" + f"# Merged from {remote_file.stem}\n\n" + remote_content
            local_claude.write_text(merged)
            print(f"Merged content from {remote_file.name}")
    
    def sync(self, operation: str = "both") -> bool:
        """Main sync method"""
        if not self.config.get("git_repo"):
            print("Error: No Git repository configured. Run 'setup' first.")
            return False
        
        return self.sync_git(operation)
    
    def setup_hooks(self) -> None:
        """Setup Claude Code hooks for automatic sync"""
        hooks_dir = Path.home() / ".claude-code" / "hooks"
        hooks_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        
        script_path = Path(__file__).absolute()
        
        # Create session-start hook
        start_hook = hooks_dir / "session-start.sh"
        start_hook.write_text(f"""#!/bin/bash
# Auto-sync Claude context at session start
cd ~
{script_path} pull
""")
        start_hook.chmod(0o755)
        
        # Create session-end hook  
        end_hook = hooks_dir / "session-end.sh"
        end_hook.write_text(f"""#!/bin/bash
# Auto-sync Claude context at session end
cd ~
{script_path} push
""")
        end_hook.chmod(0o755)
        
        print(f"âœ… Hooks installed in {hooks_dir}")
        print("Context will sync automatically on session start/end")


def main():
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Claude Context Sync")
    parser.add_argument("action", choices=["setup", "sync", "pull", "push", "hooks"],
                        help="Action to perform")
    parser.add_argument("--git-repo", help="Git repository URL for sync")
    
    args = parser.parse_args()
    
    sync = ClaudeSync()
    
    if args.action == "setup":
        if args.git_repo:
            sync.config["git_repo"] = args.git_repo
            with open(sync.config_path, 'w') as f:
                json.dump(sync.config, f, indent=2)
            print(f"âœ… Configuration saved to {sync.config_path}")
            print(f"Repository: {args.git_repo}")
            print(f"Machine ID: {sync.config['machine_id']}")
        else:
            print("Error: --git-repo required for setup")
    
    elif args.action == "sync":
        if sync.sync("both"):
            print("âœ… Sync completed")
    
    elif args.action == "pull":
        if sync.sync("pull"):
            print("âœ… Pull completed")
    
    elif args.action == "push":
        if sync.sync("push"):
            print("âœ… Push completed")
    
    elif args.action == "hooks":
        sync.setup_hooks()


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

#!/bin/bash
# Claude Context Sync - Basic installer
# Usage: curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install.sh | bash -s -- YOUR_GITHUB_REPO

set -e

# Colors for output
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
NC='\033[0m'

echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸš€ Claude Context Sync Installer${NC}"
echo "================================"

# Get GitHub repo from argument or prompt
GITHUB_REPO="${1:-}"
if [ -z "$GITHUB_REPO" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}Enter your GitHub repository URL for storing contexts:${NC}"
    echo "Example: https://github.com/username/claude-sync"
    read -r GITHUB_REPO
fi

# Validate repo URL
if [[ ! "$GITHUB_REPO" =~ ^https://github\.com/[^/]+/[^/]+(.git)?$ ]]; then
    echo -e "${RED}âŒ Invalid GitHub repository URL${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

# Ensure .git extension
if [[ ! "$GITHUB_REPO" =~ \.git$ ]]; then
    GITHUB_REPO="${GITHUB_REPO}.git"
fi

echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ“¦ Installing Claude Context Sync...${NC}"

# Create directories
mkdir -p ~/.claude-code/slash-commands
mkdir -p ~/.claude-sync

# Download the main sync script
echo "ğŸ“¥ Downloading claude-sync.py..."
curl -sSL -o ~/claude-sync.py https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync-simple.py
chmod +x ~/claude-sync.py

# Create slash commands
echo "ğŸ“ Creating slash commands..."

# /sync-pull
cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-pull.md << 'EOF'
Pull the latest Claude context from your remote repository.

```bash
cd ~
python3 ~/claude-sync.py pull
echo "âœ… Context synchronized from remote"
```
EOF

# /sync-push
cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-push.md << 'EOF'
Push your current Claude context to the remote repository.

```bash
cd ~
python3 ~/claude-sync.py push
echo "âœ… Context pushed to remote"
```
EOF

# /sync
cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync.md << 'EOF'
Perform a full bidirectional sync (pull then push).

```bash
cd ~
python3 ~/claude-sync.py sync
echo "âœ… Full sync completed"
```
EOF

# /sync-status
cat > ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/sync-status.md << 'EOF'
Check the current sync status and configuration.

```bash
if [ -f ~/.claude-sync/config.json ]; then
    echo "ğŸ“Š Claude Sync Status"
    echo "===================="
    echo "Config: ~/.claude-sync/config.json"
    cat ~/.claude-sync/config.json | python3 -m json.tool
    
    if [ -d ~/.claude-sync/contexts/repo/.git ]; then
        cd ~/.claude-sync/contexts/repo
        echo ""
        echo "ğŸ“… Last sync: $(git log -1 --format=%cd --date=relative 2>/dev/null || echo 'Never')"
        echo "ğŸŒ¿ Current branch: $(git branch --show-current 2>/dev/null || echo 'Not initialized')"
        echo "ğŸ“ Pending changes: $(git status --porcelain 2>/dev/null | wc -l) files"
    fi
else
    echo "âŒ Claude Sync not configured. Run installer again."
fi
```
EOF

# Configure with provided repo
echo -e "\n${BLUE}âš™ï¸  Configuring with repository: ${GITHUB_REPO}${NC}"
python3 ~/claude-sync.py setup --git-repo "$GITHUB_REPO"

# Create initial CLAUDE.md if it doesn't exist
if [ ! -f ~/CLAUDE.md ]; then
    cat > ~/CLAUDE.md << EOF
# Claude Context

Synchronized across all machines via claude-sync.

## Setup Info
- Repository: $GITHUB_REPO
- Installed: $(date)
- Machine: $(hostname)

## Project Notes

Add your project-specific context here.
EOF
    echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Created initial CLAUDE.md${NC}"
fi

# Try initial push
echo -e "\n${BLUE}ğŸ“¤ Attempting initial sync...${NC}"
if python3 ~/claude-sync.py push 2>/dev/null; then
    echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Initial sync successful${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${BLUE}â„¹ï¸  Initial sync skipped (repository might need to be created)${NC}"
fi

echo -e "\n${GREEN}âœ¨ Installation complete!${NC}"
echo -e "\n${BLUE}Available slash commands:${NC}"
echo "  /sync-pull    - Pull latest context from GitHub"
echo "  /sync-push    - Push current context to GitHub"
echo "  /sync         - Full bidirectional sync"
echo "  /sync-status  - Check sync status"
echo -e "\n${BLUE}Quick start:${NC}"
echo "1. Make sure your GitHub repo exists: ${GITHUB_REPO%.git}"
echo "2. Use /sync-push to upload your current context"
echo "3. On other machines, run this installer with the same repo"
echo -e "\n${GREEN}Happy syncing! ğŸš€${NC}"

input.content:
# Claude Context Sync - Windows PowerShell installer
# Usage: iex ((New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install-windows.ps1'))

param(
    [Parameter(Mandatory=$false)]
    [string]$GitRepo,
    
    [Parameter(Mandatory=$false)]
    [string]$Level = "essential"
)

# Colors for output
$Green = [System.ConsoleColor]::Green
$Blue = [System.ConsoleColor]::Blue
$Yellow = [System.ConsoleColor]::Yellow
$Red = [System.ConsoleColor]::Red

function Write-ColorOutput($ForegroundColor, $Message) {
    $originalColor = $Host.UI.RawUI.ForegroundColor
    $Host.UI.RawUI.ForegroundColor = $ForegroundColor
    Write-Output $Message
    $Host.UI.RawUI.ForegroundColor = $originalColor
}

Write-ColorOutput $Blue "ğŸš€ Claude Context Sync Extended - Windows Installer"
Write-Output "=================================================="

# Get GitHub repo from parameter or prompt
if (-not $GitRepo) {
    Write-ColorOutput $Blue "Enter your GitHub repository URL:"
    $GitRepo = Read-Host
}

# Validate repo URL
if ($GitRepo -notmatch '^https://github\.com/[^/]+/[^/]+(\.git)?$') {
    Write-ColorOutput $Red "âŒ Invalid GitHub repository URL"
    exit 1
}

# Ensure .git extension
if ($GitRepo -notmatch '\.git$') {
    $GitRepo += ".git"
}

# Validate sync level
if ($Level -notin @("essential", "full")) {
    Write-ColorOutput $Yellow "âš  Invalid sync level '$Level', using 'essential'"
    $Level = "essential"
}

Write-ColorOutput $Blue "ğŸ“¦ Installing Claude Context Sync Extended..."
Write-Output "Repository: $GitRepo"
Write-Output "Sync Level: $Level"

# Create directories
$claudeDir = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE ".claude"
$commandsDir = Join-Path $claudeDir "commands"
$syncDir = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE ".claude-sync"

New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $commandsDir | Out-Null
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $syncDir | Out-Null

# Download the extended sync script
Write-Output "ğŸ“¥ Downloading claude-sync-extended.py..."
$syncScriptPath = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE "claude-sync-extended.py"
try {
    Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync-extended.py" -OutFile $syncScriptPath
} catch {
    Write-ColorOutput $Red "âŒ Failed to download sync script: $_"
    exit 1
}

# Create enhanced slash commands
Write-Output "ğŸ“ Creating extended slash commands..."

# /sync-full-setup
@"
Configure Claude Context Sync Extended with full data synchronization.

``````bash
if [ -z "`$1" ]; then
    echo "Usage: /sync-full-setup <github-repo-url> [essential|full]"
    echo "Sync levels:"
    echo "  essential - CLAUDE.md, settings, sessions, MCP configs"
    echo "  full      - Everything including commands and agents"
    exit 1
fi

LEVEL="`${2:-essential}"
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo "`$1" --level "`$LEVEL"
echo "âœ… Extended sync configured!"
echo "ğŸ“Š Run /sync-status to see what will be synced"
``````
"@ | Out-File -FilePath (Join-Path $commandsDir "sync-full-setup.md") -Encoding utf8

# /sync-status
@"
Show detailed Claude Context Sync status and what will be synced.

``````bash
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py status
``````
"@ | Out-File -FilePath (Join-Path $commandsDir "sync-status.md") -Encoding utf8

# /sync-pull-full
@"
Pull ALL Claude data from remote repository (sessions, settings, MCP configs).

``````bash
cd ~
echo "ğŸ”„ Pulling full Claude data from remote..."
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py pull
echo "âœ… Full data sync completed!"
echo "ğŸ“‹ Your sessions, settings, and MCP configs are now synchronized"
``````
"@ | Out-File -FilePath (Join-Path $commandsDir "sync-pull-full.md") -Encoding utf8

# /sync-push-full
@"
Push ALL Claude data to remote repository for other PCs to access.

``````bash
cd ~
echo "ğŸ“¤ Pushing full Claude data to remote..."
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py push
echo "âœ… All data pushed to remote!"
echo "ğŸ”— Other PCs can now pull your sessions, settings, and configurations"
``````
"@ | Out-File -FilePath (Join-Path $commandsDir "sync-push-full.md") -Encoding utf8

# /sync-full
@"
Perform complete bidirectional sync of ALL Claude data.

``````bash
cd ~
echo "ğŸ”„ Performing full Claude data sync..."
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py sync
echo "âœ… Complete sync finished!"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“Š Synced data includes:"
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ’¬ All conversation sessions"
echo "  â€¢ âš™ï¸  Claude settings and preferences" 
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ”Œ MCP server configurations"
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ“ Project-specific contexts"
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ—‚ï¸  User commands and agents"
``````
"@ | Out-File -FilePath (Join-Path $commandsDir "sync-full.md") -Encoding utf8

# Keep the simple commands too
@"
Pull Claude context from remote (essential data only).

``````bash
cd ~
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py pull
echo "âœ… Essential data synchronized"
``````
"@ | Out-File -FilePath (Join-Path $commandsDir "sync-pull.md") -Encoding utf8

@"
Push Claude context to remote (essential data only).

``````bash
cd ~
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py push
echo "âœ… Essential data pushed"
``````
"@ | Out-File -FilePath (Join-Path $commandsDir "sync-push.md") -Encoding utf8

# Setup with provided repo and level
Write-ColorOutput $Blue "`nâš™ï¸  Configuring with repository and sync level..."
try {
    & python3 $syncScriptPath setup --git-repo $GitRepo --level $Level
} catch {
    Write-ColorOutput $Red "âŒ Failed to configure sync: $_"
    exit 1
}

# Show status
Write-ColorOutput $Blue "`nğŸ“Š Current sync configuration:"
& python3 $syncScriptPath status

# Try initial sync
Write-ColorOutput $Blue "`nğŸ”„ Attempting initial sync..."
try {
    & python3 $syncScriptPath push 2>$null
    Write-ColorOutput $Green "âœ… Initial sync successful"
} catch {
    Write-ColorOutput $Yellow "â„¹ï¸  Initial sync skipped (repository might be empty)"
}

Write-ColorOutput $Green "`nâœ¨ Claude Context Sync Extended installed!"
Write-ColorOutput $Blue "`nğŸ“‹ Available commands:"
Write-Output "Essential sync:"
Write-Output "  /sync-pull          - Pull context and basic settings"
Write-Output "  /sync-push          - Push context and basic settings"
Write-Output ""
Write-Output "Extended sync:"
Write-Output "  /sync-pull-full     - Pull ALL Claude data (sessions, MCP, etc.)"
Write-Output "  /sync-push-full     - Push ALL Claude data"
Write-Output "  /sync-full          - Complete bidirectional sync"
Write-Output "  /sync-status        - Show detailed sync status"

Write-ColorOutput $Blue "`nğŸ¯ What gets synced at '$Level' level:"

if ($Level -eq "essential") {
    Write-Output "  âœ… CLAUDE.md context files"
    Write-Output "  âœ… Claude settings (~/.claude.json)"
    Write-Output "  âœ… Conversation sessions"
    Write-Output "  âœ… MCP server configurations"
    Write-Output "  âœ… Global Claude memory"
} else {
    Write-Output "  âœ… Everything from 'essential' plus:"
    Write-Output "  âœ… User commands and agents"
    Write-Output "  âœ… All user preferences"
}

Write-ColorOutput $Blue "`nğŸš€ Quick start:"
Write-Output "1. Use /sync-push-full to upload your current Claude setup"
Write-Output "2. On other PCs, install with same repo and run /sync-pull-full"

content.text: Perfect! Now let me create a comprehensive setup guide for both platforms:

input.content:
# Claude Code Sync Setup Guide

Complete setup instructions for syncing Claude Code between macOS and Windows PCs.

## Prerequisites

- **Git installed** on both machines with GitHub access
- **Python 3.6+** available on both systems
- **GitHub account** with ability to create private repositories

## Step 1: Create GitHub Repository

1. Go to [GitHub](https://github.com/new)
2. Create a **PRIVATE** repository named `claude-sync` (or any name you prefer)
3. Don't initialize with README, .gitignore, or license
4. Note the repository URL (e.g., `https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync`)

## Step 2: Installation on macOS

### Option A: One-line installation (Full sync)
```bash
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git full
```

### Option B: One-line installation (Essential sync only)
```bash
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git essential
```

### Option C: Manual installation
```bash
# Download the script
curl -sSL -o ~/claude-sync-extended.py https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync-extended.py
chmod +x ~/claude-sync-extended.py

# Setup with your repository
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git --level full

# Create slash commands directory
mkdir -p ~/.claude/commands

# Download and create slash commands (see install-full.sh for command definitions)
# Or run the full installer to get all commands automatically
```

## Step 3: Installation on Windows

### Option A: PowerShell one-liner (Run as Administrator)
```powershell
iex ((New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install-windows.ps1'))
```

### Option B: Manual Windows installation
```powershell
# Create directories
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path "$env:USERPROFILE\.claude\commands"
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path "$env:USERPROFILE\.claude-sync"

# Download the sync script
Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync-extended.py" -OutFile "$env:USERPROFILE\claude-sync-extended.py"

# Setup with your repository
python3 "$env:USERPROFILE\claude-sync-extended.py" setup --git-repo "https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git" --level full

# Create slash commands manually (see install-windows.ps1 for definitions)
```

## Step 4: Sync Levels Explained

### Essential Level (Recommended for most users)
Syncs core Claude Code data:
- âœ… CLAUDE.md context files (current directory)
- âœ… Claude configuration (`~/.claude.json`)
- âœ… Global settings (`~/.claude/settings.json`)
- âœ… Local settings (`~/.claude/settings.local.json`)
- âœ… All conversation sessions (`~/.claude/projects/`)
- âœ… Global Claude memory (`~/.claude/CLAUDE.md`)

### Full Level (Power users)
Everything from Essential plus:
- âœ… User commands (`~/.claude/commands/`)
- âœ… User agents (`~/.claude/agents/`)
- âš ï¸  Credentials (backed up but not synced for security)

## Step 5: Available Commands

After installation, these slash commands are available in Claude Code:

| Command | Description | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|----------|
| `/sync-status` | Show sync configuration and status | Check what will be synced |
| `/sync-pull` | Pull essential data from remote | Get updates from other machines |
| `/sync-push` | Push essential data to remote | Upload your current setup |
| `/sync-pull-full` | Pull ALL Claude data | Full sync from other machines |
| `/sync-push-full` | Push ALL Claude data | Upload everything to remote |
| `/sync-full` | Complete bidirectional sync | Two-way sync of all data |

## Step 6: Initial Setup

### On your primary machine (where you have existing Claude Code data):

1. **Push your data to GitHub:**
   ```
   /sync-push-full
   ```
   This uploads all your current sessions, settings, and configurations.

2. **Verify the sync worked:**
   ```
   /sync-status
   ```

### On your secondary machine:

1. **Pull data from GitHub:**
   ```
   /sync-pull-full
   ```
   This downloads everything from your primary machine.

2. **Verify the sync:**
   ```
   /sync-status
   ```

## Step 7: Daily Workflow

### When starting work on a machine:
```
/sync-pull-full
```

### When finishing work on a machine:
```
/sync-push-full
```

### For automatic two-way sync:
```
/sync-full
```

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

#### 1. "Repository access denied"
- Ensure your GitHub repository is created and you have access
- Check your Git credentials: `git config --global user.name` and `git config --global user.email`
- Try cloning the repository manually: `git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git`

#### 2. "No Git repository configured"
- Run setup again: `python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo YOUR_REPO_URL --level full`

#### 3. "Permission denied" errors
- On Windows: Run PowerShell as Administrator
- On macOS: Check file permissions with `ls -la ~/claude-sync-extended.py`

#### 4. Python not found
- **Windows**: Install Python from python.org or Microsoft Store
- **macOS**: Install Python via Homebrew: `brew install python3`

#### 5. Sync conflicts
```bash
# Check what's wrong
/sync-status

# Force clean sync (will lose local changes)
cd ~/.claude-sync/data/repo
git reset --hard origin/main
/sync-pull-full
```

### Manual Recovery

If you need to manually access your synced data:
```bash
cd ~/.claude-sync/data/repo
ls -la  # See all machine data folders
```

Each machine gets its own folder with a unique ID, so you can manually copy files if needed.

## Security Considerations

- âœ… Uses your private GitHub repository
- âœ… Credentials are backed up but not synced
- âœ… All data encrypted in transit via HTTPS
- âœ… Each machine gets unique, anonymous ID
- âš ï¸  Don't sync the repository publicly
- âš ï¸  Be careful with MCP server configurations containing secrets

## Advanced Usage

### Custom sync frequency
Set up cron jobs (macOS/Linux) or Task Scheduler (Windows) to run sync commands automatically.

### Selective sync
Currently syncs everything at the chosen level. Future versions will support selective sync.

### Team sharing
You can share the repository with team members, but be careful about credentials and personal settings.

## File Locations Reference

### macOS/Linux:
- Config: `~/.claude-sync/config.json`
- Data: `~/.claude-sync/data/`
- Commands: `~/.claude/commands/`
- Claude Config: `~/.claude.json`
- Sessions: `~/.claude/projects/`

### Windows:
- Config: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude-sync\config.json`
- Data: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude-sync\data\`
- Commands: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude\commands\`
- Claude Config: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude.json`
- Sessions: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude\projects\`

## Support

If you encounter issues:
1. Check this troubleshooting guide
2. Run `/sync-status` to diagnose
3. Check the GitHub repository for updates
4. Open an issue on the original repository

Happy syncing! ğŸš€

# Claude Code Sync Setup Guide

Complete setup instructions for syncing Claude Code between macOS and Windows PCs.

## Prerequisites

- **Git installed** on both machines with GitHub access
- **Python 3.6+** available on both systems
- **GitHub account** with ability to create private repositories

## Step 1: Create GitHub Repository

1. Go to [GitHub](https://github.com/new)
2. Create a **PRIVATE** repository named `claude-sync` (or any name you prefer)
3. Don't initialize with README, .gitignore, or license
4. Note the repository URL (e.g., `https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync`)

## Step 2: Installation on macOS

### Option A: One-line installation (Full sync)
```bash
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git full
```

### Option B: One-line installation (Essential sync only)
```bash
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git essential
```

### Option C: Manual installation
```bash
# Download the script
curl -sSL -o ~/claude-sync-extended.py https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync-extended.py
chmod +x ~/claude-sync-extended.py

# Setup with your repository
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git --level full

# Create slash commands directory
mkdir -p ~/.claude/commands

# Download and create slash commands (see install-full.sh for command definitions)
# Or run the full installer to get all commands automatically
```

## Step 3: Installation on Windows

### Option A: PowerShell one-liner (Run as Administrator)
```powershell
iex ((New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install-windows.ps1'))
```

### Option B: Manual Windows installation
```powershell
# Create directories
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path "$env:USERPROFILE\.claude\commands"
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path "$env:USERPROFILE\.claude-sync"

# Download the sync script

```

## Step 4: Sync Levels Explained

### Essential Level (Recommended for most users)

- âš ï¸  Credentials (backed up but not synced for security)

## Step 5: Available Commands

After installation, these slash commands are available in Claude Code:

| Command | Description | Use Case |

| `/sync-push-full` | Push ALL Claude data | Upload everything to remote |
| `/sync-full` | Complete bidirectional sync | Two-way sync of all data |

## Step 6: Initial Setup

### On your primary machine (where you have existing Claude Code data):

1. **Push your data to GitHub:**
   ```
   /sync-push-full
   ```
   This uploads all your current sessions, settings, and configurations.

2. **Verify the sync worked:**
   ```
   /sync-status
   ```

### On your secondary machine:

1. **Pull data from GitHub:**
   ```
   /sync-pull-full

   This downloads everything from your primary machine.

2. **Verify the sync:**

## Step 7: Daily Workflow

```

## Troubleshooting

#### 1. "Repository access denied"
