toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Claude Code Sync Setup Guide

Complete setup instructions for syncing Claude Code between macOS and Windows PCs.

## Prerequisites

- **Git installed** on both machines with GitHub access
- **Python 3.6+** available on both systems
- **GitHub account** with ability to create private repositories

## Step 1: Create GitHub Repository

1. Go to [GitHub](https://github.com/new)
2. Create a **PRIVATE** repository named `claude-sync` (or any name you prefer)
3. Don't initialize with README, .gitignore, or license
4. Note the repository URL (e.g., `https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync`)

## Step 2: Installation on macOS

### Option A: One-line installation (Full sync)
```bash
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git full
```

### Option B: One-line installation (Essential sync only)
```bash
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git essential
```

### Option C: Manual installation
```bash
# Download the script
curl -sSL -o ~/claude-sync-extended.py https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync-extended.py
chmod +x ~/claude-sync-extended.py

# Setup with your repository
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git --level full

# Create slash commands directory
mkdir -p ~/.claude/commands

# Download and create slash commands (see install-full.sh for command definitions)
# Or run the full installer to get all commands automatically
```

## Step 3: Installation on Windows

### Option A: PowerShell one-liner (Run as Administrator)
```powershell
iex ((New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install-windows.ps1'))
```

### Option B: Manual Windows installation
```powershell
# Create directories
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path "$env:USERPROFILE\.claude\commands"
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path "$env:USERPROFILE\.claude-sync"

# Download the sync script
Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync-extended.py" -OutFile "$env:USERPROFILE\claude-sync-extended.py"

# Setup with your repository
python3 "$env:USERPROFILE\claude-sync-extended.py" setup --git-repo "https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git" --level full

# Create slash commands manually (see install-windows.ps1 for definitions)
```

## Step 4: Sync Levels Explained

### Essential Level (Recommended for most users)
Syncs core Claude Code data:
- âœ… CLAUDE.md context files (current directory)
- âœ… Claude configuration (`~/.claude.json`)
- âœ… Global settings (`~/.claude/settings.json`)
- âœ… Local settings (`~/.claude/settings.local.json`)
- âœ… All conversation sessions (`~/.claude/projects/`)
- âœ… Global Claude memory (`~/.claude/CLAUDE.md`)

### Full Level (Power users)
Everything from Essential plus:
- âœ… User commands (`~/.claude/commands/`)
- âœ… User agents (`~/.claude/agents/`)
- âš ï¸  Credentials (backed up but not synced for security)

## Step 5: Available Commands

After installation, these slash commands are available in Claude Code:

| Command | Description | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|----------|
| `/sync-status` | Show sync configuration and status | Check what will be synced |
| `/sync-pull` | Pull essential data from remote | Get updates from other machines |
| `/sync-push` | Push essential data to remote | Upload your current setup |
| `/sync-pull-full` | Pull ALL Claude data | Full sync from other machines |
| `/sync-push-full` | Push ALL Claude data | Upload everything to remote |
| `/sync-full` | Complete bidirectional sync | Two-way sync of all data |

## Step 6: Initial Setup

### On your primary machine (where you have existing Claude Code data):

1. **Push your data to GitHub:**
   ```
   /sync-push-full
   ```
   This uploads all your current sessions, settings, and configurations.

2. **Verify the sync worked:**
   ```
   /sync-status
   ```

### On your secondary machine:

1. **Pull data from GitHub:**
   ```
   /sync-pull-full
   ```
   This downloads everything from your primary machine.

2. **Verify the sync:**
   ```
   /sync-status
   ```

## Step 7: Daily Workflow

### When starting work on a machine:
```
/sync-pull-full
```

### When finishing work on a machine:
```
/sync-push-full
```

### For automatic two-way sync:
```
/sync-full
```

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

#### 1. "Repository access denied"
- Ensure your GitHub repository is created and you have access
- Check your Git credentials: `git config --global user.name` and `git config --global user.email`
- Try cloning the repository manually: `git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git`

#### 2. "No Git repository configured"
- Run setup again: `python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo YOUR_REPO_URL --level full`

#### 3. "Permission denied" errors
- On Windows: Run PowerShell as Administrator
- On macOS: Check file permissions with `ls -la ~/claude-sync-extended.py`

#### 4. Python not found
- **Windows**: Install Python from python.org or Microsoft Store
- **macOS**: Install Python via Homebrew: `brew install python3`

#### 5. Sync conflicts
```bash
# Check what's wrong
/sync-status

# Force clean sync (will lose local changes)
cd ~/.claude-sync/data/repo
git reset --hard origin/main
/sync-pull-full
```

### Manual Recovery

If you need to manually access your synced data:
```bash
cd ~/.claude-sync/data/repo
ls -la  # See all machine data folders
```

Each machine gets its own folder with a unique ID, so you can manually copy files if needed.

## Security Considerations

- âœ… Uses your private GitHub repository
- âœ… Credentials are backed up but not synced
- âœ… All data encrypted in transit via HTTPS
- âœ… Each machine gets unique, anonymous ID
- âš ï¸  Don't sync the repository publicly
- âš ï¸  Be careful with MCP server configurations containing secrets

## Advanced Usage

### Custom sync frequency
Set up cron jobs (macOS/Linux) or Task Scheduler (Windows) to run sync commands automatically.

### Selective sync
Currently syncs everything at the chosen level. Future versions will support selective sync.

### Team sharing
You can share the repository with team members, but be careful about credentials and personal settings.

## File Locations Reference

### macOS/Linux:
- Config: `~/.claude-sync/config.json`
- Data: `~/.claude-sync/data/`
- Commands: `~/.claude/commands/`
- Claude Config: `~/.claude.json`
- Sessions: `~/.claude/projects/`

### Windows:
- Config: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude-sync\config.json`
- Data: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude-sync\data\`
- Commands: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude\commands\`
- Claude Config: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude.json`
- Sessions: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude\projects\`

## Support

If you encounter issues:
1. Check this troubleshooting guide
2. Run `/sync-status` to diagnose
3. Check the GitHub repository for updates
4. Open an issue on the original repository

Happy syncing! ğŸš€

#### 4. Python not found
- **Windows**: Install Python from python.org or Microsoft Store
- **macOS**: Install Python via Homebrew: `brew install python3`

#### 5. Sync conflicts
```bash
# Check what's wrong
/sync-status

# Force clean sync (will lose local changes)
cd ~/.claude-sync/data/repo
git reset --hard origin/main
/sync-pull-full
```

### Manual Recovery

If you need to manually access your synced data:
```bash
cd ~/.claude-sync/data/repo
ls -la  # See all machine data folders
```

Each machine gets its own folder with a unique ID, so you can manually copy files if needed.

## Security Considerations

- âœ… Uses your private GitHub repository
- âœ… Credentials are backed up but not synced
- âœ… All data encrypted in transit via HTTPS
- âœ… Each machine gets unique, anonymous ID
- âš ï¸  Don't sync the repository publicly
- âš ï¸  Be careful with MCP server configurations containing secrets

## Advanced Usage

### Custom sync frequency
Set up cron jobs (macOS/Linux) or Task Scheduler (Windows) to run sync commands automatically.

### Selective sync
Currently syncs everything at the chosen level. Future versions will support selective sync.

### Team sharing
You can share the repository with team members, but be careful about credentials and personal settings.

## File Locations Reference

### macOS/Linux:
- Config: `~/.claude-sync/config.json`
- Data: `~/.claude-sync/data/`
- Commands: `~/.claude/commands/`
- Claude Config: `~/.claude.json`
- Sessions: `~/.claude/projects/`

### Windows:
- Config: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude-sync\config.json`
- Data: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude-sync\data\`
- Commands: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude\commands\`
- Claude Config: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude.json`
- Sessions: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude\projects\`

## Support

If you encounter issues:
1. Check this troubleshooting guide
2. Run `/sync-status` to diagnose
3. Check the GitHub repository for updates
4. Open an issue on the original repository

Happy syncing! ğŸš€

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Claude Code Sync Setup Guide - Davide's Personal Setup

Complete setup instructions for syncing Claude Code between your macOS personal laptop and Windows work PC.

## ğŸ”§ Your Repository Setup:
- **Sync Tool Repository**: `https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project` (corrected version)
- **Data Sync Repository**: `https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync` (your Claude Code data)

## Prerequisites

- **Git installed** on both machines with GitHub access
- **Python 3.6+** available on both systems
- **GitHub account** with ability to create private repositories

## Step 1: Create GitHub Repository

1. Go to [GitHub](https://github.com/new)
2. Create a **PRIVATE** repository named `claude-sync` (or any name you prefer)
3. Don't initialize with README, .gitignore, or license
4. Note the repository URL (e.g., `https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync`)

## Step 2: Installation on macOS

### Option A: One-line installation (Full sync) - **YOUR CORRECTED VERSION**
```bash
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git full
```

### Option B: One-line installation (Essential sync only) - **YOUR CORRECTED VERSION**
```bash
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git essential
```

### Option C: Manual installation
```bash
# Download the script
curl -sSL -o ~/claude-sync-extended.py https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync-extended.py
chmod +x ~/claude-sync-extended.py

# Setup with your repository
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git --level full

# Create slash commands directory
mkdir -p ~/.claude/commands

# Download and create slash commands (see install-full.sh for command definitions)
# Or run the full installer to get all commands automatically
```

## Step 3: Installation on Windows

### Option A: PowerShell one-liner (Run as Administrator)
```powershell
iex ((New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install-windows.ps1'))
```

### Option B: Manual Windows installation
```powershell
# Create directories
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path "$env:USERPROFILE\.claude\commands"
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path "$env:USERPROFILE\.claude-sync"

# Download the sync script
Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync-extended.py" -OutFile "$env:USERPROFILE\claude-sync-extended.py"

# Setup with your repository
python3 "$env:USERPROFILE\claude-sync-extended.py" setup --git-repo "https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git" --level full

# Create slash commands manually (see install-windows.ps1 for definitions)
```

## Step 4: Sync Levels Explained

### Essential Level (Recommended for most users)
Syncs core Claude Code data:
- âœ… CLAUDE.md context files (current directory)
- âœ… Claude configuration (`~/.claude.json`)
- âœ… Global settings (`~/.claude/settings.json`)
- âœ… Local settings (`~/.claude/settings.local.json`)
- âœ… All conversation sessions (`~/.claude/projects/`)
- âœ… Global Claude memory (`~/.claude/CLAUDE.md`)

### Full Level (Power users)
Everything from Essential plus:
- âœ… User commands (`~/.claude/commands/`)
- âœ… User agents (`~/.claude/agents/`)
- âš ï¸  Credentials (backed up but not synced for security)

## Step 5: Available Commands

After installation, these slash commands are available in Claude Code:

| Command | Description | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|----------|
| `/sync-status` | Show sync configuration and status | Check what will be synced |
| `/sync-pull` | Pull essential data from remote | Get updates from other machines |
| `/sync-push` | Push essential data to remote | Upload your current setup |
| `/sync-pull-full` | Pull ALL Claude data | Full sync from other machines |
| `/sync-push-full` | Push ALL Claude data | Upload everything to remote |
| `/sync-full` | Complete bidirectional sync | Two-way sync of all data |

## Step 6: Initial Setup

### On your primary machine (where you have existing Claude Code data):

1. **Push your data to GitHub:**
   ```
   /sync-push-full
   ```
   This uploads all your current sessions, settings, and configurations.

2. **Verify the sync worked:**
   ```
   /sync-status
   ```

### On your secondary machine:

1. **Pull data from GitHub:**
   ```
   /sync-pull-full
   ```
   This downloads everything from your primary machine.

2. **Verify the sync:**
   ```
   /sync-status
   ```

## Step 7: Daily Workflow

### When starting work on a machine:
```
/sync-pull-full
```

### When finishing work on a machine:
```
/sync-push-full
```

### For automatic two-way sync:
```
/sync-full
```

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

#### 1. "Repository access denied"
- Ensure your GitHub repository is created and you have access
- Check your Git credentials: `git config --global user.name` and `git config --global user.email`
- Try cloning the repository manually: `git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git`

#### 2. "No Git repository configured"
- Run setup again: `python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo YOUR_REPO_URL --level full`

#### 3. "Permission denied" errors
- On Windows: Run PowerShell as Administrator
- On macOS: Check file permissions with `ls -la ~/claude-sync-extended.py`

#### 4. Python not found
- **Windows**: Install Python from python.org or Microsoft Store
- **macOS**: Install Python via Homebrew: `brew install python3`

#### 5. Sync conflicts
```bash
# Check what's wrong
/sync-status

# Force clean sync (will lose local changes)
cd ~/.claude-sync/data/repo
git reset --hard origin/main
/sync-pull-full
```

### Manual Recovery

If you need to manually access your synced data:
```bash
cd ~/.claude-sync/data/repo
ls -la  # See all machine data folders
```

Each machine gets its own folder with a unique ID, so you can manually copy files if needed.

## Security Considerations

- âœ… Uses your private GitHub repository
- âœ… Credentials are backed up but not synced
- âœ… All data encrypted in transit via HTTPS
- âœ… Each machine gets unique, anonymous ID
- âš ï¸  Don't sync the repository publicly
- âš ï¸  Be careful with MCP server configurations containing secrets

## Advanced Usage

### Custom sync frequency
Set up cron jobs (macOS/Linux) or Task Scheduler (Windows) to run sync commands automatically.

### Selective sync
Currently syncs everything at the chosen level. Future versions will support selective sync.

### Team sharing
You can share the repository with team members, but be careful about credentials and personal settings.

## File Locations Reference

### macOS/Linux:
- Config: `~/.claude-sync/config.json`
- Data: `~/.claude-sync/data/`
- Commands: `~/.claude/commands/`
- Claude Config: `~/.claude.json`
- Sessions: `~/.claude/projects/`

### Windows:
- Config: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude-sync\config.json`
- Data: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude-sync\data\`
- Commands: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude\commands\`
- Claude Config: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude.json`
- Sessions: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude\projects\`

## Support

If you encounter issues:
1. Check this troubleshooting guide
2. Run `/sync-status` to diagnose
3. Check the GitHub repository for updates
4. Open an issue on the original repository

Happy syncing! ğŸš€

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Claude Code Sync Setup Guide - Davide's Personal Setup

Complete setup instructions for syncing Claude Code between your macOS personal laptop and Windows work PC.

## ğŸ”§ Your Repository Setup:
- **Sync Tool Repository**: `https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project` (corrected version)
- **Data Sync Repository**: `https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync` (your Claude Code data)

## Prerequisites

- **Git installed** on both machines with GitHub access
- **Python 3.6+** available on both systems
- **GitHub account** with ability to create private repositories

## Step 1: Create GitHub Repository

1. Go to [GitHub](https://github.com/new)
2. Create a **PRIVATE** repository named `claude-sync` (or any name you prefer)
3. Don't initialize with README, .gitignore, or license
4. Note the repository URL (e.g., `https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync`)

## Step 2: Installation on macOS

### Option A: One-line installation (Full sync) - **YOUR CORRECTED VERSION**
```bash
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git full
```

### Option B: One-line installation (Essential sync only) - **YOUR CORRECTED VERSION**
```bash
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git essential
```

### Option C: Manual installation - **YOUR CORRECTED VERSION**
```bash
# Download the corrected script
curl -sSL -o ~/claude-sync-extended.py https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/claude-sync-extended.py
chmod +x ~/claude-sync-extended.py

# Setup with your repository
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git --level full

# Create slash commands directory
mkdir -p ~/.claude/commands

# Download and create slash commands (see install-full.sh for command definitions)
# Or run the full installer to get all commands automatically
```

## Step 3: Installation on Windows

### Option A: PowerShell one-liner (Run as Administrator) - **YOUR CORRECTED VERSION**
```powershell
# Download and run with your repositories
$script = (New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/install-windows.ps1')
Invoke-Expression $script -GitRepo "https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git" -Level "full"
```

### Option B: Manual Windows installation
```powershell
# Create directories
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path "$env:USERPROFILE\.claude\commands"
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path "$env:USERPROFILE\.claude-sync"

# Download the sync script
Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync-extended.py" -OutFile "$env:USERPROFILE\claude-sync-extended.py"

# Setup with your repository
python3 "$env:USERPROFILE\claude-sync-extended.py" setup --git-repo "https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git" --level full

# Create slash commands manually (see install-windows.ps1 for definitions)
```

## Step 4: Sync Levels Explained

### Essential Level (Recommended for most users)
Syncs core Claude Code data:
- âœ… CLAUDE.md context files (current directory)
- âœ… Claude configuration (`~/.claude.json`)
- âœ… Global settings (`~/.claude/settings.json`)
- âœ… Local settings (`~/.claude/settings.local.json`)
- âœ… All conversation sessions (`~/.claude/projects/`)
- âœ… Global Claude memory (`~/.claude/CLAUDE.md`)

### Full Level (Power users)
Everything from Essential plus:
- âœ… User commands (`~/.claude/commands/`)
- âœ… User agents (`~/.claude/agents/`)
- âš ï¸  Credentials (backed up but not synced for security)

## Step 5: Available Commands

After installation, these slash commands are available in Claude Code:

| Command | Description | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|----------|
| `/sync-status` | Show sync configuration and status | Check what will be synced |
| `/sync-pull` | Pull essential data from remote | Get updates from other machines |
| `/sync-push` | Push essential data to remote | Upload your current setup |
| `/sync-pull-full` | Pull ALL Claude data | Full sync from other machines |
| `/sync-push-full` | Push ALL Claude data | Upload everything to remote |
| `/sync-full` | Complete bidirectional sync | Two-way sync of all data |

## Step 6: Initial Setup

### On your primary machine (where you have existing Claude Code data):

1. **Push your data to GitHub:**
   ```
   /sync-push-full
   ```
   This uploads all your current sessions, settings, and configurations.

2. **Verify the sync worked:**
   ```
   /sync-status
   ```

### On your secondary machine:

1. **Pull data from GitHub:**
   ```
   /sync-pull-full
   ```
   This downloads everything from your primary machine.

2. **Verify the sync:**
   ```
   /sync-status
   ```

## Step 7: Daily Workflow

### When starting work on a machine:
```
/sync-pull-full
```

### When finishing work on a machine:
```
/sync-push-full
```

### For automatic two-way sync:
```
/sync-full
```

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

#### 1. "Repository access denied"
- Ensure your GitHub repository is created and you have access
- Check your Git credentials: `git config --global user.name` and `git config --global user.email`
- Try cloning the repository manually: `git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git`

#### 2. "No Git repository configured"
- Run setup again: `python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo YOUR_REPO_URL --level full`

#### 3. "Permission denied" errors
- On Windows: Run PowerShell as Administrator
- On macOS: Check file permissions with `ls -la ~/claude-sync-extended.py`

#### 4. Python not found
- **Windows**: Install Python from python.org or Microsoft Store
- **macOS**: Install Python via Homebrew: `brew install python3`

#### 5. Sync conflicts
```bash
# Check what's wrong
/sync-status

# Force clean sync (will lose local changes)
cd ~/.claude-sync/data/repo
git reset --hard origin/main
/sync-pull-full
```

### Manual Recovery

If you need to manually access your synced data:
```bash
cd ~/.claude-sync/data/repo
ls -la  # See all machine data folders
```

Each machine gets its own folder with a unique ID, so you can manually copy files if needed.

## Security Considerations

- âœ… Uses your private GitHub repository
- âœ… Credentials are backed up but not synced
- âœ… All data encrypted in transit via HTTPS
- âœ… Each machine gets unique, anonymous ID
- âš ï¸  Don't sync the repository publicly
- âš ï¸  Be careful with MCP server configurations containing secrets

## Advanced Usage

### Custom sync frequency
Set up cron jobs (macOS/Linux) or Task Scheduler (Windows) to run sync commands automatically.

### Selective sync
Currently syncs everything at the chosen level. Future versions will support selective sync.

### Team sharing
You can share the repository with team members, but be careful about credentials and personal settings.

## File Locations Reference

### macOS/Linux:
- Config: `~/.claude-sync/config.json`
- Data: `~/.claude-sync/data/`
- Commands: `~/.claude/commands/`
- Claude Config: `~/.claude.json`
- Sessions: `~/.claude/projects/`

### Windows:
- Config: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude-sync\config.json`
- Data: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude-sync\data\`
- Commands: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude\commands\`
- Claude Config: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude.json`
- Sessions: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude\projects\`

## Support

If you encounter issues:
1. Check this troubleshooting guide
2. Run `/sync-status` to diagnose
3. Check the GitHub repository for updates
4. Open an issue on the original repository

Happy syncing! ğŸš€

Now, regarding your request to make `/sync-{etc}` commands available from the terminal (not just inside Claude Code), here's my plan:

input.plan:
# Plan: Create Terminal Commands for Claude Sync

## Overview
Convert Claude Code slash commands to standalone terminal commands that can be run directly from bash/PowerShell.

## Implementation Steps

### 1. Create Shell Scripts/Batch Files
**macOS/Linux:**
- Create executable shell scripts in `/usr/local/bin/` (or user's bin directory)
- Scripts: `sync-status`, `sync-pull`, `sync-push`, `sync-pull-full`, `sync-push-full`, `sync-full`

**Windows:**
- Create `.bat` files in a directory added to PATH
- Same command names as macOS but with `.bat` extension

### 2. Script Contents
Each script will:
- Call `python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py` with appropriate arguments
- Handle error checking and output formatting
- Work from any directory (use absolute paths)

### 3. Installation Process
**macOS:**
- Add script creation to `install-full.sh`
- Make scripts executable (`chmod +x`)
- Optionally add to PATH if not using `/usr/local/bin/`

**Windows:**
- Add batch file creation to `install-windows.ps1`
- Create scripts in `%USERPROFILE%\bin\` and add to PATH
- Or use existing PATH directory

### 4. Files to Create/Modify
- `install-full.sh` - Add terminal script creation for macOS
- `install-windows.ps1` - Add batch file creation for Windows
- Individual script files (6 total per platform)
- Update `SETUP_GUIDE.md` with terminal command documentation

### 5. Expected Result
After installation, users can run:
```bash
# From any terminal/command prompt:
sync-status
sync-pull-full
sync-push-full
sync-full
```

Instead of only being able to use them as Claude Code slash commands.

This maintains the existing Claude Code slash command functionality while adding terminal accessibility.

#!/bin/bash
# Claude Context Sync Extended - Full sync installer
# Usage: curl -sSL https://example.com/install-full.sh | bash -s -- REPO_URL [essential|full]

set -e

GREEN='\033[0;32m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
NC='\033[0m'

echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸš€ Claude Context Sync Extended Installer${NC}"
echo "=========================================="

# Get arguments
GITHUB_REPO="${1:-}"
SYNC_LEVEL="${2:-essential}"

if [ -z "$GITHUB_REPO" ]; then
    echo -e "${BLUE}Enter your GitHub repository URL:${NC}"
    read -r GITHUB_REPO
fi

if [[ ! "$GITHUB_REPO" =~ ^https://github\.com/[^/]+/[^/]+(.git)?$ ]]; then
    echo -e "${RED}âŒ Invalid GitHub repository URL${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

if [[ ! "$GITHUB_REPO" =~ \.git$ ]]; then
    GITHUB_REPO="${GITHUB_REPO}.git"
fi

# Validate sync level
if [[ "$SYNC_LEVEL" != "essential" && "$SYNC_LEVEL" != "full" ]]; then
    echo -e "${YELLOW}âš  Invalid sync level '$SYNC_LEVEL', using 'essential'${NC}"
    SYNC_LEVEL="essential"
fi

echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ“¦ Installing Claude Context Sync Extended...${NC}"
echo "Repository: $GITHUB_REPO"
echo "Sync Level: $SYNC_LEVEL"

# Create directories
mkdir -p ~/.claude/commands
mkdir -p ~/.claude-sync

# Download the extended sync script
echo "ğŸ“¥ Downloading claude-sync-extended.py..."
curl -sSL -o ~/claude-sync-extended.py \
    https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync-extended.py
chmod +x ~/claude-sync-extended.py

# Create enhanced slash commands
echo "ğŸ“ Creating extended slash commands..."

# /sync-full-setup
cat > ~/.claude/commands/sync-full-setup.md << 'EOF'
Configure Claude Context Sync Extended with full data synchronization.

```bash
if [ -z "$1" ]; then
    echo "Usage: /sync-full-setup <github-repo-url> [essential|full]"
    echo "Sync levels:"
    echo "  essential - CLAUDE.md, settings, sessions, MCP configs"
    echo "  full      - Everything including shell snapshots, slash commands"
    exit 1
fi

LEVEL="${2:-essential}"
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo "$1" --level "$LEVEL"
echo "âœ… Extended sync configured!"
echo "ğŸ“Š Run /sync-status to see what will be synced"
```
EOF

# /sync-status
cat > ~/.claude/commands/sync-status.md << 'EOF'
Show detailed Claude Context Sync status and what will be synced.

```bash
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py status
```
EOF

# /sync-pull-full
cat > ~/.claude/commands/sync-pull-full.md << 'EOF'
Pull ALL Claude data from remote repository (sessions, settings, MCP configs).

```bash
cd ~
echo "ğŸ”„ Pulling full Claude data from remote..."
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py pull
echo "âœ… Full data sync completed!"
echo "ğŸ“‹ Your sessions, settings, and MCP configs are now synchronized"
```
EOF

# /sync-push-full
cat > ~/.claude/commands/sync-push-full.md << 'EOF'
Push ALL Claude data to remote repository for other PCs to access.

```bash
cd ~
echo "ğŸ“¤ Pushing full Claude data to remote..."
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py push
echo "âœ… All data pushed to remote!"
echo "ğŸ”— Other PCs can now pull your sessions, settings, and configurations"
```
EOF

# /sync-full
cat > ~/.claude/commands/sync-full.md << 'EOF'
Perform complete bidirectional sync of ALL Claude data.

```bash
cd ~
echo "ğŸ”„ Performing full Claude data sync..."
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py sync
echo "âœ… Complete sync finished!"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“Š Synced data includes:"
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ’¬ All conversation sessions"
echo "  â€¢ âš™ï¸  Claude settings and preferences" 
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ”Œ MCP server configurations"
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ“ Todo lists and task data"
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ—‚ï¸  Project-specific contexts"
```
EOF

# Keep the simple commands too
cat > ~/.claude/commands/sync-pull.md << 'EOF'
Pull Claude context from remote (essential data only).

```bash
cd ~
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py pull
echo "âœ… Essential data synchronized"
```
EOF

cat > ~/.claude/commands/sync-push.md << 'EOF'
Push Claude context to remote (essential data only).

```bash
cd ~
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py push
echo "âœ… Essential data pushed"
```
EOF

# Setup with provided repo and level
echo -e "\n${BLUE}âš™ï¸  Configuring with repository and sync level...${NC}"
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo "$GITHUB_REPO" --level "$SYNC_LEVEL"

# Show status
echo -e "\n${BLUE}ğŸ“Š Current sync configuration:${NC}"
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py status

# Try initial sync
echo -e "\n${BLUE}ğŸ”„ Attempting initial sync...${NC}"
if python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py push 2>/dev/null; then
    echo -e "${GREEN}âœ… Initial sync successful${NC}"
else
    echo -e "${YELLOW}â„¹ï¸  Initial sync skipped (repository might be empty)${NC}"
fi

echo -e "\n${GREEN}âœ¨ Claude Context Sync Extended installed!${NC}"
echo -e "\n${BLUE}ğŸ“‹ Available commands:${NC}"
echo "Essential sync:"
echo "  /sync-pull          - Pull context and basic settings"
echo "  /sync-push          - Push context and basic settings"
echo ""
echo "Extended sync:"
echo "  /sync-pull-full     - Pull ALL Claude data (sessions, MCP, etc.)"
echo "  /sync-push-full     - Push ALL Claude data"
echo "  /sync-full          - Complete bidirectional sync"
echo "  /sync-status        - Show detailed sync status"
echo ""
echo -e "${BLUE}ğŸ¯ What gets synced at '$SYNC_LEVEL' level:${NC}"

if [ "$SYNC_LEVEL" = "essential" ]; then
    echo "  âœ… CLAUDE.md context files"
    echo "  âœ… Claude settings (~/.claude.json)"
    echo "  âœ… Conversation sessions"
    echo "  âœ… MCP server configurations"
    echo "  âœ… Todo lists"
else
    echo "  âœ… Everything from 'essential' plus:"
    echo "  âœ… Shell integration snapshots"
    echo "  âœ… Custom slash commands"
    echo "  âœ… All user preferences"
fi

echo -e "\n${BLUE}ğŸš€ Quick start:${NC}"
echo "1. Use /sync-push-full to upload your current Claude setup"
echo "2. On other PCs, install with same repo and run /sync-pull-full"
echo "3. All your sessions, settings, and configs will be synchronized!"
echo -e "\n${GREEN}Happy syncing! ğŸ‰${NC}"

# Claude Context Sync - Windows PowerShell installer
# Usage: iex ((New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/install-windows.ps1'))

param(
    [Parameter(Mandatory=$false)]
    [string]$GitRepo,
    
    [Parameter(Mandatory=$false)]
    [string]$Level = "essential"
)

# Colors for output
$Green = [System.ConsoleColor]::Green
$Blue = [System.ConsoleColor]::Blue
$Yellow = [System.ConsoleColor]::Yellow
$Red = [System.ConsoleColor]::Red

function Write-ColorOutput($ForegroundColor, $Message) {
    $originalColor = $Host.UI.RawUI.ForegroundColor
    $Host.UI.RawUI.ForegroundColor = $ForegroundColor
    Write-Output $Message
    $Host.UI.RawUI.ForegroundColor = $originalColor
}

Write-ColorOutput $Blue "ğŸš€ Claude Context Sync Extended - Windows Installer"
Write-Output "=================================================="

# Get GitHub repo from parameter or prompt
if (-not $GitRepo) {
    Write-ColorOutput $Blue "Enter your GitHub repository URL:"
    $GitRepo = Read-Host
}

# Validate repo URL
if ($GitRepo -notmatch '^https://github\.com/[^/]+/[^/]+(\.git)?$') {
    Write-ColorOutput $Red "âŒ Invalid GitHub repository URL"
    exit 1
}

# Ensure .git extension
if ($GitRepo -notmatch '\.git$') {
    $GitRepo += ".git"
}

# Validate sync level
if ($Level -notin @("essential", "full")) {
    Write-ColorOutput $Yellow "âš  Invalid sync level '$Level', using 'essential'"
    $Level = "essential"
}

Write-ColorOutput $Blue "ğŸ“¦ Installing Claude Context Sync Extended..."
Write-Output "Repository: $GitRepo"
Write-Output "Sync Level: $Level"

# Create directories
$claudeDir = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE ".claude"
$commandsDir = Join-Path $claudeDir "commands"
$syncDir = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE ".claude-sync"

New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $commandsDir | Out-Null
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $syncDir | Out-Null

# Download the extended sync script
Write-Output "ğŸ“¥ Downloading claude-sync-extended.py..."
$syncScriptPath = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE "claude-sync-extended.py"
try {
    Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/shaike1/claude-sync/main/claude-sync-extended.py" -OutFile $syncScriptPath
} catch {
    Write-ColorOutput $Red "âŒ Failed to download sync script: $_"
    exit 1
}

# Create enhanced slash commands
Write-Output "ğŸ“ Creating extended slash commands..."

# /sync-full-setup
@"
Configure Claude Context Sync Extended with full data synchronization.

``````bash
if [ -z "`$1" ]; then
    echo "Usage: /sync-full-setup <github-repo-url> [essential|full]"
    echo "Sync levels:"
    echo "  essential - CLAUDE.md, settings, sessions, MCP configs"
    echo "  full      - Everything including commands and agents"
    exit 1
fi

LEVEL="`${2:-essential}"
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo "`$1" --level "`$LEVEL"
echo "âœ… Extended sync configured!"
echo "ğŸ“Š Run /sync-status to see what will be synced"
``````
"@ | Out-File -FilePath (Join-Path $commandsDir "sync-full-setup.md") -Encoding utf8

# /sync-status
@"
Show detailed Claude Context Sync status and what will be synced.

``````bash
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py status
``````
"@ | Out-File -FilePath (Join-Path $commandsDir "sync-status.md") -Encoding utf8

# /sync-pull-full
@"
Pull ALL Claude data from remote repository (sessions, settings, MCP configs).

``````bash
cd ~
echo "ğŸ”„ Pulling full Claude data from remote..."
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py pull
echo "âœ… Full data sync completed!"
echo "ğŸ“‹ Your sessions, settings, and MCP configs are now synchronized"
``````
"@ | Out-File -FilePath (Join-Path $commandsDir "sync-pull-full.md") -Encoding utf8

# /sync-push-full
@"
Push ALL Claude data to remote repository for other PCs to access.

``````bash
cd ~
echo "ğŸ“¤ Pushing full Claude data to remote..."
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py push
echo "âœ… All data pushed to remote!"
echo "ğŸ”— Other PCs can now pull your sessions, settings, and configurations"
``````
"@ | Out-File -FilePath (Join-Path $commandsDir "sync-push-full.md") -Encoding utf8

# /sync-full
@"
Perform complete bidirectional sync of ALL Claude data.

``````bash
cd ~
echo "ğŸ”„ Performing full Claude data sync..."
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py sync
echo "âœ… Complete sync finished!"
echo ""
echo "ğŸ“Š Synced data includes:"
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ’¬ All conversation sessions"
echo "  â€¢ âš™ï¸  Claude settings and preferences" 
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ”Œ MCP server configurations"
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ“ Project-specific contexts"
echo "  â€¢ ğŸ—‚ï¸  User commands and agents"
``````
"@ | Out-File -FilePath (Join-Path $commandsDir "sync-full.md") -Encoding utf8

# Keep the simple commands too
@"
Pull Claude context from remote (essential data only).

``````bash
cd ~
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py pull
echo "âœ… Essential data synchronized"
``````
"@ | Out-File -FilePath (Join-Path $commandsDir "sync-pull.md") -Encoding utf8

@"
Push Claude context to remote (essential data only).

``````bash
cd ~
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py push
echo "âœ… Essential data pushed"
``````
"@ | Out-File -FilePath (Join-Path $commandsDir "sync-push.md") -Encoding utf8

# Setup with provided repo and level
Write-ColorOutput $Blue "`nâš™ï¸  Configuring with repository and sync level..."
try {
    & python3 $syncScriptPath setup --git-repo $GitRepo --level $Level
} catch {
    Write-ColorOutput $Red "âŒ Failed to configure sync: $_"
    exit 1
}

# Show status
Write-ColorOutput $Blue "`nğŸ“Š Current sync configuration:"
& python3 $syncScriptPath status

# Try initial sync

Write-ColorOutput $Blue "`nğŸ¯ What gets synced at '$Level' level:"

} else {
    Write-Output "  âœ… Everything from 'essential' plus:"

    Write-Output "  âœ… All user preferences"
}

Write-ColorOutput $Blue "`nğŸš€ Quick start:"

input.new_string:
## ğŸ“‹ Available Commands

After installation, you have both Claude Code slash commands and terminal commands:

### Claude Code Slash Commands (Inside Claude Code):

| Command | Description | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|----------|
| `/sync-status` | Show sync configuration and status | Check what will be synced |
| `/sync-pull` | Pull essential data from remote | Get updates from other machines |
| `/sync-push` | Push essential data to remote | Upload your current setup |
| `/sync-pull-full` | Pull ALL Claude data | Full sync from other machines |
| `/sync-push-full` | Push ALL Claude data | Upload everything to remote |
| `/sync-full` | Complete bidirectional sync | Two-way sync of all data |

### Terminal Commands (From any terminal/command prompt):

| Command | Description | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|----------|
| `sync-status` | Show sync configuration and status | Check what will be synced |
| `sync-pull` | Pull essential data from remote | Get updates from other machines |
| `sync-push` | Push essential data to remote | Upload your current setup |
| `sync-pull-full` | Pull ALL Claude data | Full sync from other machines |
| `sync-push-full` | Push ALL Claude data | Upload everything to remote |
| `sync-full` | Complete bidirectional sync | Two-way sync of all data |

# Claude Code Sync Setup Guide - Davide's Personal Setup

Complete setup instructions for syncing Claude Code between your macOS personal laptop and Windows work PC.

## ğŸ”§ Your Repository Setup:
- **Sync Tool Repository**: `https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project` (corrected version)
- **Data Sync Repository**: `https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync` (your Claude Code data)

## âœ… Current Status (macOS - Personal Laptop):
- **Installation**: âœ… COMPLETE - claude-sync installed with corrected paths
- **Configuration**: âœ… COMPLETE - configured to sync to `davide-f98/claude-sync`
- **Sync Level**: âœ… FULL - syncs everything including commands and agents
- **Machine ID**: `523df774`
- **Available Commands**: `/sync-status`, `/sync-pull-full`, `/sync-push-full`, `/sync-full`

## ğŸ“‹ Next Steps:
1. **Push your current data**: Run `/sync-push-full` to upload your macOS Claude Code data
2. **Install on Windows**: Follow the Windows installation instructions below
3. **Pull on Windows**: Run `/sync-pull-full` on Windows to get your macOS data

## Prerequisites

- **Git installed** on both machines with GitHub access
- **Python 3.6+** available on both systems
- **GitHub account** with ability to create private repositories

## Step 1: Create GitHub Repository

1. Go to [GitHub](https://github.com/new)
2. Create a **PRIVATE** repository named `claude-sync` (or any name you prefer)
3. Don't initialize with README, .gitignore, or license
4. Note the repository URL (e.g., `https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync`)

## Step 2: Installation on macOS

### Option A: One-line installation (Full sync) - **YOUR CORRECTED VERSION**
```bash
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git full
```

### Option B: One-line installation (Essential sync only) - **YOUR CORRECTED VERSION**
```bash
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git essential
```

### Option C: Manual installation - **YOUR CORRECTED VERSION**
```bash
# Download the corrected script
curl -sSL -o ~/claude-sync-extended.py https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/claude-sync-extended.py
chmod +x ~/claude-sync-extended.py

# Setup with your repository
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git --level full

# Create slash commands directory
mkdir -p ~/.claude/commands

# Download and create slash commands (see install-full.sh for command definitions)
# Or run the full installer to get all commands automatically
```

## Step 3: Installation on Windows

### Option A: PowerShell one-liner (Run as Administrator) - **YOUR CORRECTED VERSION**
```powershell
# Download and run with your repositories
$script = (New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/install-windows.ps1')
Invoke-Expression $script -GitRepo "https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git" -Level "full"
```

### Option B: Manual Windows installation - **YOUR CORRECTED VERSION**
```powershell
# Create directories
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path "$env:USERPROFILE\.claude\commands"
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path "$env:USERPROFILE\.claude-sync"

# Download the corrected sync script
Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/claude-sync-extended.py" -OutFile "$env:USERPROFILE\claude-sync-extended.py"

# Setup with your repository
python3 "$env:USERPROFILE\claude-sync-extended.py" setup --git-repo "https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git" --level full

# Create slash commands manually (see install-windows.ps1 for definitions)
```

## Step 4: Sync Levels Explained

### Essential Level (Recommended for most users)
Syncs core Claude Code data:
- âœ… CLAUDE.md context files (current directory)
- âœ… Claude configuration (`~/.claude.json`)
- âœ… Global settings (`~/.claude/settings.json`)
- âœ… Local settings (`~/.claude/settings.local.json`)
- âœ… All conversation sessions (`~/.claude/projects/`)
- âœ… Global Claude memory (`~/.claude/CLAUDE.md`)

### Full Level (Power users)
Everything from Essential plus:
- âœ… User commands (`~/.claude/commands/`)
- âœ… User agents (`~/.claude/agents/`)
- âš ï¸  Credentials (backed up but not synced for security)

## Step 5: Available Commands

After installation, these slash commands are available in Claude Code:

| Command | Description | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|----------|
| `/sync-status` | Show sync configuration and status | Check what will be synced |
| `/sync-pull` | Pull essential data from remote | Get updates from other machines |
| `/sync-push` | Push essential data to remote | Upload your current setup |
| `/sync-pull-full` | Pull ALL Claude data | Full sync from other machines |
| `/sync-push-full` | Push ALL Claude data | Upload everything to remote |
| `/sync-full` | Complete bidirectional sync | Two-way sync of all data |

## Step 6: Initial Setup

### On your primary machine (where you have existing Claude Code data):

1. **Push your data to GitHub:**
   ```
   /sync-push-full
   ```
   This uploads all your current sessions, settings, and configurations.

2. **Verify the sync worked:**
   ```
   /sync-status
   ```

### On your secondary machine:

1. **Pull data from GitHub:**
   ```
   /sync-pull-full
   ```
   This downloads everything from your primary machine.

2. **Verify the sync:**
   ```
   /sync-status
   ```

## Step 7: Daily Workflow

### When starting work on a machine:
```
/sync-pull-full
```

### When finishing work on a machine:
```
/sync-push-full
```

### For automatic two-way sync:
```
/sync-full
```

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

#### 1. "Repository access denied"
- Ensure your GitHub repository is created and you have access
- Check your Git credentials: `git config --global user.name` and `git config --global user.email`
- Try cloning the repository manually: `git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git`

#### 2. "No Git repository configured"
- Run setup again: `python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo YOUR_REPO_URL --level full`

#### 3. "Permission denied" errors
- On Windows: Run PowerShell as Administrator
- On macOS: Check file permissions with `ls -la ~/claude-sync-extended.py`

#### 4. Python not found
- **Windows**: Install Python from python.org or Microsoft Store
- **macOS**: Install Python via Homebrew: `brew install python3`

#### 5. Sync conflicts
```bash
# Check what's wrong
/sync-status

# Force clean sync (will lose local changes)
cd ~/.claude-sync/data/repo
git reset --hard origin/main
/sync-pull-full
```

### Manual Recovery

If you need to manually access your synced data:
```bash
cd ~/.claude-sync/data/repo
ls -la  # See all machine data folders
```

Each machine gets its own folder with a unique ID, so you can manually copy files if needed.

## Security Considerations

- âœ… Uses your private GitHub repository
- âœ… Credentials are backed up but not synced
- âœ… All data encrypted in transit via HTTPS
- âœ… Each machine gets unique, anonymous ID
- âš ï¸  Don't sync the repository publicly
- âš ï¸  Be careful with MCP server configurations containing secrets

## Advanced Usage

### Custom sync frequency
Set up cron jobs (macOS/Linux) or Task Scheduler (Windows) to run sync commands automatically.

### Selective sync
Currently syncs everything at the chosen level. Future versions will support selective sync.

### Team sharing
You can share the repository with team members, but be careful about credentials and personal settings.

## File Locations Reference

### macOS/Linux:
- Config: `~/.claude-sync/config.json`
- Data: `~/.claude-sync/data/`
- Commands: `~/.claude/commands/`
- Claude Config: `~/.claude.json`
- Sessions: `~/.claude/projects/`

### Windows:
- Config: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude-sync\config.json`
- Data: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude-sync\data\`
- Commands: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude\commands\`
- Claude Config: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude.json`
- Sessions: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude\projects\`

## Support

If you encounter issues:
1. Check this troubleshooting guide
2. Run `/sync-status` to diagnose
3. Check the GitHub repository for updates
4. Open an issue on the original repository

Happy syncing! ğŸš€

| Command | Description | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|----------|
| `/sync-status` | Show sync configuration and status | Check what will be synced |
| `/sync-pull` | Pull essential data from remote | Get updates from other machines |
| `/sync-push` | Push essential data to remote | Upload your current setup |
| `/sync-pull-full` | Pull ALL Claude data | Full sync from other machines |
| `/sync-push-full` | Push ALL Claude data | Upload everything to remote |
| `/sync-full` | Complete bidirectional sync | Two-way sync of all data |

### Terminal Commands (From any terminal/command prompt):

| Command | Description | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|----------|
| `sync-status` | Show sync configuration and status | Check what will be synced |
| `sync-pull` | Pull essential data from remote | Get updates from other machines |
| `sync-push` | Push essential data to remote | Upload your current setup |
| `sync-pull-full` | Pull ALL Claude data | Full sync from other machines |
| `sync-push-full` | Push ALL Claude data | Upload everything to remote |
| `sync-full` | Complete bidirectional sync | Two-way sync of all data |

## Step 6: Initial Setup

### On your primary machine (where you have existing Claude Code data):

1. **Push your data to GitHub:**
   ```
   /sync-push-full
   ```
   This uploads all your current sessions, settings, and configurations.

2. **Verify the sync worked:**
   ```
   /sync-status
   ```

### On your secondary machine:

1. **Pull data from GitHub:**
   ```
   /sync-pull-full
   ```
   This downloads everything from your primary machine.

2. **Verify the sync:**
   ```
   /sync-status
   ```

## Step 7: Daily Workflow

### When starting work on a machine:
```
/sync-pull-full
```

### When finishing work on a machine:
```
/sync-push-full
```

### For automatic two-way sync:
```
/sync-full
```

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

#### 1. "Repository access denied"
- Ensure your GitHub repository is created and you have access
- Check your Git credentials: `git config --global user.name` and `git config --global user.email`
- Try cloning the repository manually: `git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync.git`

#### 2. "No Git repository configured"
- Run setup again: `python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo YOUR_REPO_URL --level full`

#### 3. "Permission denied" errors
- On Windows: Run PowerShell as Administrator
- On macOS: Check file permissions with `ls -la ~/claude-sync-extended.py`

#### 4. Python not found
- **Windows**: Install Python from python.org or Microsoft Store
- **macOS**: Install Python via Homebrew: `brew install python3`

#### 5. Sync conflicts
```bash
# Check what's wrong
/sync-status

# Force clean sync (will lose local changes)
cd ~/.claude-sync/data/repo
git reset --hard origin/main
/sync-pull-full
```

### Manual Recovery

If you need to manually access your synced data:
```bash
cd ~/.claude-sync/data/repo
ls -la  # See all machine data folders
```

Each machine gets its own folder with a unique ID, so you can manually copy files if needed.

## Security Considerations

- âœ… Uses your private GitHub repository
- âœ… Credentials are backed up but not synced
- âœ… All data encrypted in transit via HTTPS
- âœ… Each machine gets unique, anonymous ID
- âš ï¸  Don't sync the repository publicly
- âš ï¸  Be careful with MCP server configurations containing secrets

## Advanced Usage

### Custom sync frequency
Set up cron jobs (macOS/Linux) or Task Scheduler (Windows) to run sync commands automatically.

### Selective sync
Currently syncs everything at the chosen level. Future versions will support selective sync.

### Team sharing
You can share the repository with team members, but be careful about credentials and personal settings.

## File Locations Reference

### macOS/Linux:
- Config: `~/.claude-sync/config.json`
- Data: `~/.claude-sync/data/`
- Commands: `~/.claude/commands/`
- Claude Config: `~/.claude.json`
- Sessions: `~/.claude/projects/`

### Windows:
- Config: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude-sync\config.json`
- Data: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude-sync\data\`
- Commands: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude\commands\`
- Claude Config: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude.json`
- Sessions: `%USERPROFILE%\.claude\projects\`

## Support

If you encounter issues:
1. Check this troubleshooting guide
2. Run `/sync-status` to diagnose
3. Check the GitHub repository for updates
4. Open an issue on the original repository

Happy syncing! ğŸš€

After installation, sync commands are available from any terminal:

### macOS:
Commands installed in `~/.local/bin/` and added to PATH automatically.

```bash
export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"
```

### Windows:
Commands installed in `%USERPROFILE%\bin\` and added to PATH automatically.
If commands don't work, restart Command Prompt/PowerShell.

### Usage Examples:
```bash
# Check sync status
sync-status

# Quick sync from anywhere
sync-full

# Push latest changes
sync-push-full

# Pull updates from other machines
sync-pull-full
```

# Claude Code Sync Setup Guide - Davide's Personal Setup

Complete setup instructions for syncing Claude Code between your macOS personal laptop and Windows work PC.

## ğŸ”§ Your Repository Setup:
- **Sync Tool Repository**: `https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project` (corrected version)
- **Data Sync Repository**: `https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync` (your Claude Code data)

## âœ… Current Status (macOS - Personal Laptop):
- **Installation**: âœ… COMPLETE - claude-sync installed with corrected paths
- **Configuration**: âœ… COMPLETE - configured to sync to `davide-f98/claude-sync`
- **Sync Level**: âœ… FULL - syncs everything including commands and agents
- **Machine ID**: `523df774`
- **Available Commands**: `/sync-status`, `/sync-pull-full`, `/sync-push-full`, `/sync-full`

## ğŸ“‹ Next Steps:
1. **Push your current data**: Run `/sync-push-full` to upload your macOS Claude Code data
2. **Install on Windows**: Follow the Windows installation instructions below
3. **Pull on Windows**: Run `/sync-pull-full` on Windows to get your macOS data

## Prerequisites

- **Git installed** on both machines with GitHub access
- **Python 3.6+** available on both systems
- **GitHub account** with ability to create private repositories

## Step 1: Create GitHub Repository

1. Go to [GitHub](https://github.com/new)
2. Create a **PRIVATE** repository named `claude-sync` (or any name you prefer)
3. Don't initialize with README, .gitignore, or license
4. Note the repository URL (e.g., `https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/claude-sync`)

## Step 2: Installation on macOS

### Option A: One-line installation (Full sync) - **YOUR CORRECTED VERSION**
```bash
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git full
```

### Option B: One-line installation (Essential sync only) - **YOUR CORRECTED VERSION**
```bash
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git essential
```

### Option C: Manual installation - **YOUR CORRECTED VERSION**
```bash
# Download the corrected script
curl -sSL -o ~/claude-sync-extended.py https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/claude-sync-extended.py
chmod +x ~/claude-sync-extended.py

# Setup with your repository
python3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py setup --git-repo https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git --level full

# Create slash commands directory
mkdir -p ~/.claude/commands

# Download and create slash commands (see install-full.sh for command definitions)
# Or run the full installer to get all commands automatically
```

## Step 3: Installation on Windows

### Option A: PowerShell one-liner (Run as Administrator) - **YOUR CORRECTED VERSION**
```powershell
# Download and run with your repositories
$script = (New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/install-windows.ps1')
Invoke-Expression $script -GitRepo "https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git" -Level "full"
```

### Option B: Manual Windows installation - **YOUR CORRECTED VERSION**
```powershell
# Create directories
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path "$env:USERPROFILE\.claude\commands"
New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path "$env:USERPROFILE\.claude-sync"

# Download the corrected sync script
Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/claude-sync-extended.py" -OutFile "$env:USERPROFILE\claude-sync-extended.py"

# Setup with your repository
python3 "$env:USERPROFILE\claude-sync-extended.py" setup --git-repo "https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git" --level full

# Create slash commands manually (see install-windows.ps1 for definitions)
```

## Step 4: Sync Levels Explained

### Essential Level (Recommended for most users)
Syncs core Claude Code data:
- âœ… CLAUDE.md context files (current directory)
- âœ… Claude configuration (`~/.claude.json`)
- âœ… Global settings (`~/.claude/settings.json`)
- âœ… Local settings (`~/.claude/settings.local.json`)
- âœ… All conversation sessions (`~/.claude/projects/`)
- âœ… Global Claude memory (`~/.claude/CLAUDE.md`)

### Full Level (Power users)
Everything from Essential plus:
- âœ… User commands (`~/.claude/commands/`)
- âœ… User agents (`~/.claude/agents/`)
- âš ï¸  Credentials (backed up but not synced for security)

## Step 5: Available Commands

message.content: why do you use the command export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH" ?

content.text:
I use `export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"` because the terminal commands (`sync-status`, `sync-pull-full`, etc.) need to be found by the shell after installation.

## Why it's needed:

1. **Default location**: The sync commands are installed in `~/.local/bin/`
2. **Not in default PATH**: Most systems don't automatically include `~/.local/bin/` in the PATH
3. **Without this**: The shell would say "command not found: sync-status"

## How the installer handles it:

The installer automatically adds this line to your shell startup files:
```bash
echo 'export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"' >> ~/.bashrc
echo 'export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"' >> ~/.zshrc
```

## For new terminal sessions:

After installation and restart, you won't need to run this command because:
- **bash**: It reads `~/.bashrc` on startup
- **zsh**: It reads `~/.zshrc` on startup  
- The PATH is automatically updated

## Why I used it this time:

Since we were testing in the same terminal session without restarting, I needed to manually set the PATH so the commands would work immediately.

## The cleaner way:

After the initial setup, you should be able to restart your terminal and run:
```bash
sync-status  # Works without export PATH
```

The `export PATH` command is just needed once per terminal session (or until you restart the terminal after installation).

I was referring to the claude-sync installation we completed earlier. When I said "after installation" or "the installer" I meant:

## What we already did:

1. **We installed the sync system** by running the setup commands that configured your macOS machine with the sync scripts
2. **The install process** created these terminal commands and locations:
   - Scripts in `~/.local/bin/`
   - Slash commands in `~/.claude/commands/`
   - Configuration files

## But we skipped a step...

Actually, looking back, we tested the sync functionality by manually copying the scripts to `~/.local/bin/`, but we **didn't run the full installation script** that would automatically add the PATH to your shell startup files.

The full installation would have been:
```bash
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/davide-f98/claude-sync-project/main/install-full.sh | bash -s -- https://github.com/davide-f98/claude-sync.git full
```

This would have:
âœ… Created the scripts in `~/.local/bin/`
âœ… Made them executable  
âœ… Added the PATH to `~/.bashrc` and `~/.zshrc`

But we manually created the scripts instead, so the PATH wasn't automatically configured.

## To fix this:

You either:
1. **Keep using `export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"`** in each session, or
2. **Add the PATH to your shell manually**:
   ```bash
   echo 'export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"' >> ~/.zshrc  # if you use zsh
   echo 'export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"' >> ~/.bashrc  # if you use bash
   ```
3. **Restart your terminal** to load the changes

That's why I was referring to "the installation" - the sync system installation process we completed earlier!

I want my code to be simple and straightforward so that my boss doesn't think i used AI to write it. The code logic should be easy to understand even for a junior dev.

Use uv commands to manage dependencies and run python scripts (e.g. uv init, uv add pandas, uv sync, uv run main.py).

Use only ASCII characters.

UNICODE characters are forbidden to use for you.

Never use "try...except" when coding in python.

Always commit after you write a new function or you fix a bug. Commit messages should be simple and straightforward, possibly only one or two sentences. 

Always keep a tracklist with the current progress of the project in its PLAN.md file so that a new session of Claude Code can read it and instantly gather informations about the project. 

Remeber to always update this tracklist.

In said PLAN.md file make sure to write the fixes you applied too.

# Using Gemini CLI for Large Codebase Analysis

When analyzing large codebases or multiple files that might exceed context limits, use the Gemini CLI with its massive
context window. Use `gemini -p` to leverage Google Gemini's large context capacity.

## File and Directory Inclusion Syntax

Use the `@` syntax to include files and directories in your Gemini prompts. The paths should be relative to WHERE you run the
  gemini command:

### Examples:

**Single file analysis:**
gemini -p "@src/main.py Explain this file's purpose and structure"

Multiple files:
gemini -p "@package.json @src/index.js Analyze the dependencies used in the code"

Entire directory:
gemini -p "@src/ Summarize the architecture of this codebase"

Multiple directories:
gemini -p "@src/ @tests/ Analyze test coverage for the source code"

Current directory and subdirectories:
gemini -p "@./ Give me an overview of this entire project"

# Or use --all_files flag:
gemini --all_files -p "Analyze the project structure and dependencies"

Implementation Verification Examples

Check if a feature is implemented:
gemini -p "@src/ @lib/ Has dark mode been implemented in this codebase? Show me the relevant files and functions"

Verify authentication implementation:
gemini -p "@src/ @middleware/ Is JWT authentication implemented? List all auth-related endpoints and middleware"

Check for specific patterns:
gemini -p "@src/ Are there any React hooks that handle WebSocket connections? List them with file paths"

Verify error handling:
gemini -p "@src/ @api/ Is proper error handling implemented for all API endpoints? Show examples of try-catch blocks"

Check for rate limiting:
gemini -p "@backend/ @middleware/ Is rate limiting implemented for the API? Show the implementation details"

Verify caching strategy:
gemini -p "@src/ @lib/ @services/ Is Redis caching implemented? List all cache-related functions and their usage"

Check for specific security measures:
gemini -p "@src/ @api/ Are SQL injection protections implemented? Show how user inputs are sanitized"

Verify test coverage for features:
gemini -p "@src/payment/ @tests/ Is the payment processing module fully tested? List all test cases"

When to Use Gemini CLI

Use gemini -p when:
- Analyzing entire codebases or large directories
- Comparing multiple large files
- Need to understand project-wide patterns or architecture
- Current context window is insufficient for the task
- Working with files totaling more than 100KB
- Verifying if specific features, patterns, or security measures are implemented
- Checking for the presence of certain coding patterns across the entire codebase

Important Notes

- Paths in @ syntax are relative to your current working directory when invoking gemini
- The CLI will include file contents directly in the context
- No need for --yolo flag for read-only analysis
- Gemini's context window can handle entire codebases that would overflow Claude's context
- When checking implementations, be specific about what you're looking for to get accurate results

message.content:
This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The conversation is summarized below:
analysis>
Let me chronologically analyze this conversation to capture all technical details, user requests, and architectural decisions:

1. **Initial Request**: User wanted to set up Claude Code sync between macOS personal laptop and Windows work PC to avoid manually moving CLAUDE.md files. They found a GitHub project (shaike1/claude-sync) that had path and configuration issues.

2. **My Approach**: I cloned the repository, identified issues with Claude Code paths, fixed them, and created a comprehensive setup guide.

3. **Key Technical Work**:
   - Fixed incorrect Claude Code directory paths (changed from ~/.claude-code/ to ~/.claude/)
   - Added Windows compatibility with cross-platform machine ID generation
   - Created PowerShell installer for Windows
   - Added terminal commands that work outside Claude Code
   - Set up two separate GitHub repositories for the sync tool vs the data

4. **User Feedback**: User specifically asked me not to mention Claude in commit messages and pointed out that using the original repository URLs would install unfixed versions.

5. **Repository Strategy**: Created two repos - claude-sync-project (for the corrected tool) and claude-sync (for actual data sync), both under davide-f98 username.

6. **Windows Updates**: User made updates from Windows PC with cross-platform fixes and Unicode character handling for CMD compatibility.

7. **Terminal Commands**: User requested commands be available from terminal, not just Claude Code, leading to creation of shell scripts and batch files.

8. **Sync Testing**: User successfully installed on Windows, added new rules to CLAUDE.md, and pushed. Then asked me to pull to sync.

9. **Final Issue**: User identified merge function problems with duplicate lines in CLAUDE.md file.

10. **Current Work**: Was attempting to fix the duplicate content in CLAUDE.md by creating a clean version, but user interrupted with summary request.
analysis>

summary>
1. Primary Request and Intent:
   The user wanted to set up seamless synchronization of Claude Code configuration and data between their personal MacBook (macOS) and work PC (Windows) to eliminate manual file transfers. They specifically wanted to sync settings, sessions, MCP configurations, and CLAUDE.md files. The user found an existing GitHub project but noted it had issues with directory paths and configuration file positioning that needed fixing. They also requested that the sync commands be available from the terminal/command prompt, not just as Claude Code slash commands.

2. Key Technical Concepts:
   - Claude Code configuration directories and file locations
   - Git-based synchronization between macOS and Windows
   - Cross-platform bash vs batch script compatibility
   - GitHub repository management (public vs private repos)
   - PATH configuration for terminal commands
   - Slash commands vs terminal commands
   - Machine ID generation for cross-platform identification
   - Merge conflict resolution and file deduplication
   - Unicode character handling in Windows CMD

3. Files and Code Sections:
   - `/Users/davide/claude-sync/claude-sync-extended.py`
     - Main sync script that handles all Claude Code data synchronization
     - Fixed paths from ~/.claude-code/ to ~/.claude/ for correct directories
     - Added cross-platform machine ID generation using platform.node() and os.getlogin()
     - Enhanced merge_claude_config() function for intelligent settings merging
     - Key code snippet: `machine_info = f"{platform.node()}-{os.getlogin()}"` for cross-platform compatibility
   
   - `/Users/davide/claude-sync/install-full.sh`
     - Updated to use correct paths for Mac installation
     - Added terminal command creation section
     - Modified to download from davide-f98 repository instead of original
     - Key addition: `mkdir -p ~/.local/bin` and PATH configuration
   
   - `/Users/davide/claude-sync/install-windows.ps1`
     - New PowerShell installer created for Windows users
     - Downloads batch files to %USERPROFILE%\bin\
     - Handles Windows PATH configuration
     - Key code: `$newPath = "$binDir;$userPath"; [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable("PATH", $newPath, "User")`
   
   - `/Users/davide/claude-sync/bin/` directory
     - Created 6 shell scripts for macOS terminal commands
     - Created 6 corresponding batch files for Windows
     - Example shell script content: `#!/bin/bash\necho "Pulling full Claude data from remote..."\npython3 ~/claude-sync-extended.py pull`
   
   - `/Users/davide/claude-sync/SETUP_GUIDE.md`
     - Comprehensive setup documentation with user's specific repository URLs
     - Documents both slash commands and terminal commands
     - Current status section showing macOS installation complete
     - Daily workflow examples for both platforms
   
   - `/Users/davide/.claude/CLAUDE.md`
     - Contains user's configuration rules including ASCII-only policy
     - Currently has duplicate content due to merge issues
     - Contains Gemini CLI usage instructions and strict ASCII-only policy

4. Errors and fixes:
   - **Double Dash Error**: Initial curl command failed with "-dash: command not found" - I fixed by ensuring proper command formatting
   - **Repository Access Error**: "404: Not Found" when downloading scripts - Fixed by manually copying local scripts first
   - **Commit Message Issue**: User explicitly requested I not include Claude references in commit messages - I removed "Generated with Claude Code" from commit message
   - **Path Configuration Issue**: Original project used wrong Claude Code directories - Fixed by updating all paths from ~/.claude-code/slash-commands/ to ~/.claude/commands/
   - **Unicode Character Issue**: Windows PC user updated the script to replace emojis with text equivalents for CMD compatibility
   - **Merge Function Problem**: User identified duplicate content in CLAUDE.md file - Was attempting to fix by creating clean version when summary was requested

5. Problem Solving:
   Successfully created a complete cross-platform synchronization system that addresses the original project's path and configuration issues. Implemented both automated installation scripts and manual setup options. Created terminal command accessibility beyond Claude Code's slash commands. Solved the repository architecture by separating the sync tool code from the actual sync data using two distinct GitHub repositories. The sync system is now operational between the user's macOS and Windows machines.

6. All user messages:
   - "i have installed claude code here on my personal macbook and on my work windows pc. I'd like to always have all the settings and all the things related to claude code always synced between the two laptops so i can work from home and don't spend time moving CLAUDE.md files back and forth. Please help me achieving this. I found this github project tha seems weel done but it has some thing related to the correct folders directories and other config files position that seem off:  https://github.com/shaike1/claude-sync  please clone the project, fix any issue you might find and then help me set it up"
   - "if i run the two commands you wrote in the quick setup, wouldn't it install the scripts with the wrong code?"
   - "my username is davide-f98 . For the corrected version of the sync program you should use claude-sync-project while for the repository to which the claude code data should be uploaded you should use claude-sync"
   - "I updated the repo claude-sync-project from the windows pc. Read all the modified files to stay up-to-date. Also i want to make the commands /sync-{etc} to be available from the terminal itself, not as a command inside claude code (this should be for both mac and windows)"
   - "i did all the steps on windows, then i added a new rule to CLAUDE.md and then used sync-push-full command. Use the sync-pull-full command to stay synced"
   - "there seem to be some problems with the merge function. the claude.md file has some lines duplicated. please fix."

7. Pending Tasks:
   - Fix the duplicate content in CLAUDE.md file caused by merge function issues
   - Complete the deduplication process that was interrupted

8. Current Work:
   I was in the process of fixing the duplicate content issue in `/Users/davide/.claude/CLAUDE.md`. The file currently contains multiple duplicate sections due to the merge process - the same content (about Gemini CLI usage and ASCII-only policies) is repeated 3 times. I had read the file and identified the problem, then created a clean version (`CLAUDE.md.clean`) with all duplicates removed, but the user interrupted this work to request a summary. The last technical action was reading the corrupted CLAUDE.md file to identify the duplicate pattern before attempting to write a clean version.

9. Optional Next Step:
   Continue with fixing the duplicate content in `/Users/davide/.claude/CLAUDE.md` by replacing the current file with the deduplicated version. The user explicitly stated: "there seem to be some problems with the merge function. the claude.md file has some lines duplicated. please fix." This task was interrupted when I was about to apply the cleaned version that removes all duplicate sections while preserving the latest ASCII-only policy rules and Gemini CLI configuration.

1â†’I want my code to be simple and straightforward so that my boss doesn't think i used AI to write it. The code logic should be easy to understand even for a junior dev.
     2â†’
     3â†’Use uv commands to manage dependencies and run python scripts (e.g. uv init, uv add pandas, uv sync, uv run main.py).
     4â†’
     5â†’Use only ASCII characters.
     6â†’
     7â†’UNICODE characters are forbidden to use for you.
     8â†’
     9â†’Never use "try...except" when coding in python.
    10â†’
    11â†’Always commit after you write a new function or you fix a bug. Commit messages should be simple and straightforward, possibly only one or two sentences. 
    12â†’
    13â†’Always keep a tracklist with the current progress of the project in its PLAN.md file so that a new session of Claude Code can read it and instantly gather informations about the project. 
    14â†’
    15â†’Remeber to always update this tracklist.
    16â†’
    17â†’In said PLAN.md file make sure to write the fixes you applied too.
    18â†’
    19â†’# Using Gemini CLI for Large Codebase Analysis
    20â†’
    21â†’When analyzing large codebases or multiple files that might exceed context limits, use the Gemini CLI with its massive
    22â†’context window. Use `gemini -p` to leverage Google Gemini's large context capacity.
    23â†’
    24â†’## File and Directory Inclusion Syntax
    25â†’
    26â†’Use the `@` syntax to include files and directories in your Gemini prompts. The paths should be relative to WHERE you run the
    27â†’  gemini command:
    28â†’
    29â†’### Examples:
    30â†’
    31â†’**Single file analysis:**
    32â†’gemini -p "@src/main.py Explain this file's purpose and structure"
    33â†’
    34â†’Multiple files:
    35â†’gemini -p "@package.json @src/index.js Analyze the dependencies used in the code"
    36â†’
    37â†’Entire directory:
    38â†’gemini -p "@src/ Summarize the architecture of this codebase"
    39â†’
    40â†’Multiple directories:
    41â†’gemini -p "@src/ @tests/ Analyze test coverage for the source code"
    42â†’
    43â†’Current directory and subdirectories:
    44â†’gemini -p "@./ Give me an overview of this entire project"
    45â†’
    46â†’# Or use --all_files flag:
    47â†’gemini --all_files -p "Analyze the project structure and dependencies"
    48â†’
    49â†’Implementation Verification Examples
    50â†’
    51â†’Check if a feature is implemented:
    52â†’gemini -p "@src/ @lib/ Has dark mode been implemented in this codebase? Show me the relevant files and functions"
    53â†’
    54â†’Verify authentication implementation:
    55â†’gemini -p "@src/ @middleware/ Is JWT authentication implemented? List all auth-related endpoints and middleware"
    56â†’
    57â†’Check for specific patterns:
    58â†’gemini -p "@src/ Are there any React hooks that handle WebSocket connections? List them with file paths"
    59â†’
    60â†’Verify error handling:
    61â†’gemini -p "@src/ @api/ Is proper error handling implemented for all API endpoints? Show examples of try-catch blocks"
    62â†’
    63â†’Check for rate limiting:
    64â†’gemini -p "@backend/ @middleware/ Is rate limiting implemented for the API? Show the implementation details"
    65â†’
    66â†’Verify caching strategy:
    67â†’gemini -p "@src/ @lib/ @services/ Is Redis caching implemented? List all cache-related functions and their usage"
    68â†’
    69â†’Check for specific security measures:
    70â†’gemini -p "@src/ @api/ Are SQL injection protections implemented? Show how user inputs are sanitized"
    71â†’
    72â†’Verify test coverage for features:
    73â†’gemini -p "@src/payment/ @tests/ Is the payment processing module fully tested? List all test cases"
    74â†’
    75â†’When to Use Gemini CLI
    76â†’
    77â†’Use gemini -p when:
    78â†’- Analyzing entire codebases or large directories
    79â†’- Comparing multiple large files
    80â†’- Need to understand project-wide patterns or architecture
    81â†’- Current context window is insufficient for the task
    82â†’- Working with files totaling more than 100KB
    83â†’- Verifying if specific features, patterns, or security measures are implemented
    84â†’- Checking for the presence of certain coding patterns across the entire codebase
    85â†’
    86â†’Important Notes

    88â†’- Paths in @ syntax are relative to your current working directory when invoking gemini

    90â†’- No need for --yolo flag for read-only analysis
    91â†’- Gemini's context window can handle entire codebases that would overflow Claude's context
